loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a resident and a farmer in Eldoret and has been in mixed farming for two years with his milk being sold within the local market. He is 43 and married with two children, age 16 and 9 years and both schooling.

Edward has made a second loan request for 32,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him buy poultry birds for a venture into poultry farming. He says he will use the income to educate his children and uplift their living standards.

He laments of high costs of medication for farm animals, especially dairy and poultry.

He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo loan services and says they are a great help to small holder farmers.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines. Nena has been in this business for 20 years. She earns additional income from her sari-sari (variety) store.

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase materials for her fishing and fish vending business.

Nena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia works hard to support her family. Ofelia is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Ofelia has been in this business for 13 years now.

Ofelia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

In the future, Ofelia would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 51 years old, married and has five children, two of whom are in school.

Marilou is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. 

Marilou requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marilou has been farming rice for eight years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal, 25, is married, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She and her husband grill fish in order to produce smoked fish to sell. 

Because the demand for smoked fish is being increased, Sophal is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more fish and firewood to produce more smoked fish to sell. 

In the future, she would like to grow her business of selling smoked fish, build a concrete house and support her children to study until they get bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and firewood to produce more smoked fish to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 40 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Vilma runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, milk, sugar, spices, noodles, etc.  

Vilma requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

In the future, Vilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a married woman who has one child. She is 28 years old, residing at Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. 

Elma used her last loan to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Elma's business is now in progress. She is requesting a new loan to purchase additional products to sell. She hopes to expand/improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Narain

texts.en:
Narain, 48, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are police officers. Additionally, she has two hectares of farming land for growing rice. One of her children is a staff member of the World Vision Organization. 

Because flooding in the rainy season has destroyed her crop, Narain requests a loan of 600 USD to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer for growing rice in the dry season to generate more income to support her family. 

In the future, she would like to grow more rice in the dry season, renew her house, and support her children in their studies until they get Bachelor degrees.

loans.use: To purchase rice seeds and fertilizer for growing rice in the dry season.

loans.name: Noeurn

texts.en: Noeurn, 51, is married and resides with her husband and eight children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a rice trader. Her husband is a palm sugar producer. Three of her children are employed, two are garment workers and another one helps her husband produce palm sugar to generate income to support the family. Noeurn is requesting a loan of USD 500 to raise capital in her business to buy more rice to sell. In the future, she would like to invest more money in her rice trading to make more profit, build a new house, and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Richel

texts.en: Richel is 24 years old and married with two children. She is from the city of Kinuman, Ozamis City. To make a living, Richel owns and operates a business raising crops. Her main source of income comes from planting and harvesting root crops to sell. Richel has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. Richel joined GDMPC in 2008 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Richel is requesting a loan of 8,600 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with his loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
Thon, 50, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband run a business buying rice and bran to sell. Two of her children are employed; one is a staff member in World Vision Organization and another one is a staff member in Vision Fund Cambodia. 

Thon is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase piglets to raise and sell when they gain weight. By doing so, she can generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a rice mill and support her children to study until they get a Bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise and sell when they gain weight.

loans.name: Estella

texts.en:
Estella is from Tabuan, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 36 years old. Estella is married and has nine children. 

To make a living, Estella owns & operates a business in the food sector, selling a variety of fruits and vegetables in the local community. Estella has been in her business for two years and earns 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Estella joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estella is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more fruit to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit  to sell.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Mrs. Van is a 65-year-old single mother who has been residing in Kompong Cham province. She is engaged in rice husbandry on their inherited farmland. She normally earns approximately $1.50 per day and it is barely enough to raise her family with nine children. Since the family has experienced difficulties, Mrs. Van has to try to work harder both physically and mentally. 

At the present, one of her sons decided to join a Korean foundation class in order to pass a test to work as a laborer in Korea. He will need some capital to pay for this course of study. Therefore, Mrs. Van wants to take out a loan from Kiva, through HKL, to pay for the course of study for her son. Mrs. Van hopes that her son will pass the exam and will be able to generate a good income to help the family. She is very grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for the course of study of her son.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is from the village of Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 56 years old and widowed with five children. 

Alfredo owns and operates a business providing "trysikad" (pedicab) services in the local community. He has been in his business for four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Alfredo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Alfredo is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. He plans to used the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Sarim

texts.en:
Sarim, 31, is married and resides with her husband and two school-aged children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are garment workers. 

In view of their meager income, Sarim would like to request a loan of USD 500 to run a new business by purchasing rice to store in the warehouse in order to sell it when the price is higher. By doing so, she will have extra income to support the family. In the future, she plans to purchase rice in large amount to store and resell when the price is higher. Moreover, she would like to build a bathroom and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase rice to store in the warehouse to sell when the price is higher.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is from Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 46 years old. Veronica is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Veronica owns and operates a general store where she sells daily-use products in the local community. Veronica has been in her business for six years and earns 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2009, Veronica joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Veronica is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Yorn, 55, is widowed and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer. All of her children are employed; two are garment workers and two more are on the staff in a rice mill.

Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Yorn is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for her children to use to commute to work. By doing so, her children can easily go to work on time and save some money from their transportation expense to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her rice farming and renew her house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to use to commute to work.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 38 years old. Mary Jean is married and has two school-aged children. 

To make a living, Mary Jean owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as sugar, candies, biscuits, shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Mary Jean has been engaged in her business for four years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2009, Mary Jean joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jean is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick,  47 years old, is married and has three children ranging from ten to sixteen years of age. He describes himself as a courageous man. He has been selling clothes for the last three years. His primary customers are students and civil servants. His challenge is insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more clothes. In the next five years, Patrick hopes to expand his business and employ people.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal, 37, is married, resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband run a business buying junk materials to sell at the junk shop. One of her children is a garment worker. 

In order to expand her business, Sophal requests a loan of USD 500 to raise capital for her business to buy more junk materials to sell in order to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a new business buying rice to resell. She hopes to renovate her house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to raise capital for her business to buy more junk materials to resell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a stall to sell clothes from in the future.

With the Kshs 80,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a mother of two children aged 15 and 11 and has been in farming for four years with her produce of vegetables and coffee sold to the local market. She also runs a retail  shop business dealing in household goods.

Pauline has requested a loan of 63,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy and insure a dairy cow for a venture into the dairy farming business.She says the acquisition of pure breed cows will help her have good production and better income from farming and improve her family's living standards.

Pauline laments of high cost of feeds in the farming business.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Hor

texts.en:
Hor (not shown in the photo; the man in the photo is Hor's husband) is 43, married, and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a vegetable vendor. Her husband is a construction foreman. Two of her children are garment workers. 

Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Hor is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use to commute to work. In the future, she would like run a new business of buying rice to store and resell when the price is higher. Moreover, she plans to renovate her house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use to commute to work.

loans.name: Lanh

texts.en:
Mr. Lanh, age 39, is a firewood seller who travels from place to place with a trailer going through the commune to generate income for the family. His wife is in the business of raising pigs in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. This couple has been blessed with two single children, one of whom is still a student. 

Mr. Lanh is seeking a loan from HKL, a Kiva partner, to purchase four piglets to support his wife’s business. He hopes to pursue a better standard of living as he strives to work and improve his family-owned businesses. In the future, he wants to build a store outside his house for his wife to sell mixed products to the people in his neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase four piglets to support his wife’s business.

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Channy, 52, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a tailor. Her husband is a rice farmer. Two of her children are garment workers. 

In order to increase her family income, Channy needs more funds to run a new business. Therefore, Channy requests a loan to purchase rice to resell when the price is higher. By doing so, she can get extra income to support her family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home, build bathroom, and support her children to study until they get a Bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase rice to resell when the price is higher.

loans.name: Kiwambi Matengo Masimeri Group

texts.en:
Vianery is a 44-year-old father of three children, one is attending secondary education. He is hard-working and has been producing maize, beans, and coffee for over five years. He is facing farming problems due to a lack of fertilizers and crop diseases.

Vianery is looking to expand his scale of production from five to 15 acres in five years. Then, he can earn more income that can be used to pay school fees, remedy the house, and cover medical expenses. 

In the attached photo, one member named Triphon is not pictured since she is seriously sick at the hospital.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Chantha, 32, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are vegetable vendors in the market. One of her children is employed at the garment factory. In order to increase her family’s income, Chantha is asking for a loan of USD 500 to purchase a plot of farmland for growing rice to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to purchase a cart for carrying rice to sell and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of farmland for growing rice.

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en:
Saroeurn, 30, is widowed and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling breads and steamed corn for over ten years to generate income to support the family as well as to cover her children's educational expenses. However, she could not afford her children's educational expense because she is the only one who makes money to support the family. Therefore, all of her children have been forced to stop studying and find a job to do in order to help her generate income to support the family. 

Currently, all of her children are employed at a garment factory. Due to the difficulty in transporting her breads and steamed corn to sell, Saroeurn is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike to carry her breads and steamed corn to sell around the village. In the future, she plans to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to carry her breads and steamed corn to sell.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is aged 24 and has been in farming for three years in his home area of Murang'a in Central Kenya. His farm produces coffee and vegetables which he sells to the local market. He says farming is his only source of income.

Jackson has requested a loan of 63,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow for a venture into dairy farming. He adds there is a ready market for milk in the region and he hopes to make gains that will enable him to build a strong foundation for his future family. He wants to have a farm of not less than four dairy cows.

Jackson is however aware of the fluctuations in milk prices which are the major challenge in dairy farming in the area.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is taking another Kiva loan of KES 50,000 to establish a pharmacy shop business. With the loan, she wants to purchase more drugs for her pharmacy business. With the additional income she intends to renovate her business premises. She dreams of establishing a nursing home in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more drugs for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Sek

texts.en: Mrs. Sek is 31 years old, a responsible mother of two school-aged kids, living in Baray district. Sek raises some piglets in a wooden pigpen behind her house in order to generate income. Recently Sek’s house has been under construction; however, 90% of it is completely built. Due to the lack of adequate funds, Sek would like to look for a loan from our lenders to buy six window frames and to pay for the labor for installing them. She is very happy about the loan given to her. She hopes that she’ll have a comfortable living after her house is completely built.

loans.use: to buy six window frames and to pay for the labor for installing them.

loans.name: Sarors

texts.en:
Sarors, 38, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a sculptor. Her husband is a clothes seller. One of her children is a garment worker. 

In order to expand her husband's business, she would like to request a loan of USD 1,200 to raise capital by buying more fashionable clothes to sell. This would make more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to invest more money in her husband's business to run a clothing shop and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to buy more fashionable clothes to sell

loans.name: Ravshan

texts.ru: Равшану 29 лет у него 2 дочери,  он имеет высшее образование. Разводит скот в течении 14 лет. Он утром отправляет скот на пастбище и вечером пастухи отгоняют скот обратно. С нашей организацией  начал сотрудничать недавно. Планирует увеличить своё поголовье скота. По совету отца он купит несколько голов коз и овец и до весны будет разводить их. Благодарен за поддержку от КИВА.
texts.en: Ravshan is 29 years old and has 2 daughters. Ravshan has higher education. He has been breeding livestock for 14 years. He takes his livestock out to pasture in the morning, and shepherds bring them home in the evening. Ravshan has recently started collaborating with our organization. He is planning on increasing the livestock numbers. As his father advised him, Ravshan will purchase a few head of goats and sheep and raise them till spring. Ravshan thanks KIVA for the support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong, 40, is married and resides with his wife and two school-age children in Kampong Chnnang Province, Cambodia. He is a construction foreman. His wife is a dessert vendor. 

Due to a lack of enough construction materials, Hong is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more to use in his work. This will enable him to run his construction work smoothly and increase his income. In the future, he would like to build a new house and support his children to go further in their education.

loans.use: to purchase more construction materials to use in his construction work

loans.name: Orif

texts.ru: Ориф 46 лет , женат имеет 4 детей. Ориф недавно начал своё сотрудничество с нашей организацией. Он живет среди гор и занимается разведением скота более 20 лет. Ориф содержит несколько голов коз и овец, занимается их откормом и продажей на скотных рынках. Для него это основной доход семьи, так как постоянной работы у него нет. В данный момент он обратился в нашу организацию за кредитом и собирается использовать его для  приобретения корма для скота, в основном для коз.
texts.en: Orif is 46 years old, married and has four children.  He recently started his collaboration with our organization.  Orif lives in the mountains and has been involved in breeding livestock for over 20 years.  He keeps several heads of goats and sheep, fattens them up and sells them at livestock markets.  This is the primary source of income for his family because he does not have a permanent job.  At the present time, Orif requested a loan from our organization and plans to use it to purchase livestock feed, mainly for goats.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is 32 and has been in farming for 10 years. She currently employs one farmhand and produces coffee and vegetables for the local market. She is married with two children who are 11 and 10 years old and both in school.

Anastacia has requested a loan of 63,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says she has decided to venture into dairy farming since it will provide her family with milk for daily consumption and she can use the income from the retail proceeds to educate her children. She aspires to produce not less than 100 liters per day.

Although she laments of serious instability in the market, she appreciates Juhudi Kilimo, reiterating that the loans are a great help to smallholder farmers.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila is taking another Kiva loan of KES 100,000 to establish another business of selling poultry, build a poultry house, and purchase chicks and chicken feed. She dreams of expanding and keeping 3,000 chickens in the future.

loans.use: to establish another business of selling poultry, build a poultry house, and purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally, 31, is single and resides with her three sisters in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for nine years and gets less salary. All of her sisters are employed; two are also garment workers and the other one is a hairdresser. 

Due to less income, Phally is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase rice to resell when the price is higher. By doing so, she will get extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a hair salon and purchase cosmetics to sell at home. Moreover, she plans to build a bathroom and a bedroom on the ground floor.

loans.use: to purchase rice to resell when the price is higher

loans.name: 04.07.8 Nam Ngạn Thanh Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thủy operates a food stall/restaurant selling meat. She is requesting a loan to purchase pork to resell.

Thủy is 41 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a six-member group, the 8 Nam Ngạn solidarity group. Thủy lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thủy has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thủy has been involved in her business for five years. The main hardship that Thủy faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thủy hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase pork to resell.

loans.name: Thoeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoeng is a mother of four children. She is a farmer as well as a recycled materials retailer who has been residing in the Prey Chor district of Kampong Cham province. Her husband shares responsibility for the family by providing construction services. 

At this time, Mrs. Thoeng will use her second loan from Kiva to build a bathroom with a toilet in it to satisfy her family’s needs. The loan will provide a healthy and comfortable living for the entire family. In the future, Mrs. Thoeng hopes to expand her existing businesses and improve her situation someday.

loans.use: to build a bathroom with a toilet in it.

loans.name: Thoeurn

texts.en:
Thoeurn, 56, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She and her husband have been involved in agricultural business for over 20 years. They have extensive experience and are successful in their career. 

She is involved in growing rice. Two of her children are garment workers. In order to improve her family's living condition, Thoeurn is requesting a loan of USD 900 to purchase a horse to pull the cart for carrying her crops and to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer for growing rice in the dry season. 

In the future, she plans to build a fence around her house.

loans.use: to purchase a horse to use in her farming work and to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer for growing rice in the dry season

loans.name: Ephantus

texts.en:
Ephantus is a resident of Murang'a and has been in active farming for 15 solid years. His farm currently produces coffee, tea, and vegetables for the local market. He says his family fully relies on farming income for their daily upkeep. He is married with one child aged three.

Ephantus has requested a loan of 63,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says he wants to venture into dairy farming and plans to expand it to a capacity of 100 liters per day in under five years. He adds that the business could do well since there has always been a ready market for milk in the region. He hopes to uplift his family's living standards with the farming income.

He too laments of high cost of feed for the animals.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Gakurya

texts.en:
Gakurya is a single man who owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past three years, he has operated a food stall business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his place of operation. Gakurya dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With the KES 80,000 he wants to purchase food stock of beans, rice, and cooking fats and furniture for his business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase food stock of beans, rice, and cooking fats and furniture for his business.

loans.name: 060203-Tiền Phong-Hoằng Châu-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Vang is 47 years old and married with two children.  She lives and works in Hoang Hoa District, a rural area in Thanh Hoa Province.   Vang is the leader of a 7-member group, the 030807-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group.  She raises poultry and cattle, a business that she has been involved in for 10 years. The main hardship that Vang faces is the lack of business capital.   

In 2007, Vang joined Kiva partner the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) to improve her  business.   She has successfully repaid four previous loans.  Vang requests another loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise.  In the future, Vang hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more business supplies and equipment.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise.

loans.name: Gakurya

texts.en:
Gakuyra is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school.  He owns a house that has electricity, but no piped water.  Gakuyra’s greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 

For the past ten years, he has operated a hardware business, selling timber to neighbors and home builders.  Gakuyra faces two major challenges: the high cost of purchasing timber and the cost of transportation.  He dreams of establishing another hardware shop in the future.

Gakuyra decided to join Kiva partner Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost his business.  He will use the KES 30,000 loan to repair his power saw that he uses to cut timber for sale.

loans.use: To repair his power saw that he uses to cut timber for sale.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Umoja Ni Nguvu Masimeri Group

texts.en:
Matride, 54 years old, is the mother of ten children, three attending secondary school. She has grown maize, beans and coffee for over 13 years. She has farming problems, such as lack of fertilizers and crop diseases. 

Matride works hard to find funds to purchase fertilizers and insecticides. In five years to come, she has a vision of increasing her scale of production from 5 to 14 acres in order to generate more income.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 31 years old and married with one nine-year-old child.  He lives in Eldoret in the North Rift region of Kenya.  He has been an active farmer for four years and also runs a transport business in the local market.  Isaac’s farm produces milk that he sells in the local market.  Isaac says dairy cow feed is extremely expensive and is the major limitation in dairy farming.

Isaac requested a 31,200 KES loan from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow.  He hopes the income will help him pay for his child’s education.  Isaac is focused on expanding his livestock supply to ten cows, possibly with the income generated from the current dairy cows and transport business.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow for his dairy farming business.

loans.name: Yaroslav

texts.ru:
Ярослав женат. Его супругу зовут Инга.  У них двое замечательных детей. В семье теплые взаимоотношения. Ярослав имеет свой бизнес.

Раньше Ярослав был на заработках в Москве, но ему надоело быть так далеко от семьи. И тогда он заработанные деньги вложил в свой бизнес.  На протяжении пяти лет Ярослав занимается продажей колгот, лосин, шапок перчаток и т.д. Он имеет хорошую торговую точку на рынке, а также Ярослав ездит со своим товаром по селам. Он целеустремленный, энергичный и трудолюбивый.  Ярослав планирует расширять свой бизнес, а доход потратить на улучшение условий проживания семьи.

Ярослав просит предоставить ему 20,000 гривен на пополнение оборотных средств.
texts.en: Yaroslav is married.  His wife's name is Inga, and they have two beautiful children.  The family members have a good relationship among each other.  Yaroslav has his own business.  Previously, he was in Moscow for work, but got tired of being so far away from his family.  Then, he invested his earnings into his own business.  Yaroslav has been involved in selling stockings, tights, hats, gloves and the like for five years.  He has a good retail outlet at the market and also travels with his merchandise to villages.  He is a goal-oriented, energetic and hardworking person.  Yaroslav plans to expand his business and spend the profit to improve his family's living conditions.  He is requesting a loan in the sum of 20,000 hryvnia to increase his working capital.

loans.use: to expand merchandise selection

loans.name: Tulkin

texts.ru: Тулкин женат имеет троих детей. Жена домохозяйка.10 лет он занимается выращиванием ячменя и лука.Для посева следует подготовить землю, обработать минеральными удобрениями Земля приносит хорошие плоды, если ухаживать за ней. Урожай он продает оптом и часть оставляет для продажи позже.  Как поднимутся цены на товар он продает его на рынке. Тулкин хочет получить займ в размере 1500 сомони для покупки семян и ГСМ к весеннему посеву. Он будет благодарен вам, если вы его поддержите. Спасибо.
texts.en: Tulkin is married and has three children.  His wife is a homemaker.  He has been involved in growing barley and onions for ten years.  He needs to prepare the land for sowing and treat it with mineral fertilizers.  The land yields a good harvest if it is taken care of.  Tulkin sells the harvest wholesale and leaves some for a later sale.  As product prices rise, he sells it at the market.  Tulkin wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 1500 somoni to purchase seeds and fuel for the spring sowing.  He will be grateful to you, if you support him.  Thank you.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fuel

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a single man and lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.  His greatest monthly expense is rent.  For the past five years, Omar has operated a matatu (public vehicle transport business).   His potential customers are passersby.  The high cost of fuel is a major challenge for his business.  Omar dreams of owning a fleet of matatus in the future.

Omar decided to join Kiva partner Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost his business.  He will use the KES 20,000 loan to service his motor vehicle engine that he uses for the transport business.

loans.use: To service his motor vehicle engine that he uses for the transport business.

loans.name: Amani  Group

texts.en:
Beda, 48 years old, is the father of three children, all attending secondary school. He has been growing maize, beans and coffee for over twelve years. He is experiencing low income due to crop diseases and lack of fertilizers.

Beda is looking for financial support to buy fertilizers and insecticides. He also has a vision to increase the scale of production from 15 to 24 acres in five years in order to earn more income to be used to pay school fees, buy clothes and cover medical expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and gum boots

loans.name: Guy Roger

texts.fr:
Client de 38 ans, celibataire avec 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 2 mois et 5 ans, n'ayant pas pu faire des longues etudes ,il s'arrête en classe de 6eme et commence avec la vente des habits pour se prendre en charge .

Il ya une année, il est client et bénéficie de plusieurs prêts, et a partir de cette année ,son commerce a connu un réel essor , son historique de remboursement a été très favorable et il a fait des épargnes considérables .
Avec ce nouveau prêt, il va renforcer le stock  des pantalons jeans, des polos, des marinières des chemises.

Tres pragmatique, il a de très grande ambition, ouvrir une grande boutique et s'occuper de la scolarité de ses enfants et investir pour acheter une parcelle pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Guy Roger, age 38, is unmarried with two children, aged 2 months and 5 years. Since he was unable to pursue his studies, he dropped out of school after six years, and started selling clothes to provide for himself.

He's been a client of Kiva's partner, HOPE, for one year and already benefited from several loans. Last year, his business started blossoming, his repayment history is very good, and he managed to put a lot of money away.

With this new loan, he will bolster his stock of trousers, jeans, polo shirts, long-sleeve shirts, and shirts.

Very pragmatic, he has big ambitions: to open a large shop, take care of his children's schooling, and buy a land lot for his family.

loans.use: to buy trousers, jeans, polo shirts, long-sleeve shirts, and shirts

loans.name: Sheway

texts.en:
Sheway is a 35-year-old man who lives in Sana'a, Yemen. He is a father of one son & one daughter only. He has a shop for selling basic grocery products in a small public area. He is not literate but has 10 years experience in this field. He started his business by opening a small shop with a simple amount of capital. As his business is small and a far distance from town, he uses that to help old families so they don't have to go to the market in the city and attempts as much as possible to provide his customers needs himself. So the store is not just a source of income and profit.

Then, the shop burned down and the wholesalers hesitate to provide him with the required goods  dealing with him as a lower class person, which became a challenge for him. In spite of that, he was able to return his shop back to usual but he could not buy all the items he had before as he needs financial support.  

So, Sheway applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to buy grocery items for his business. This loan would help him remodel the shop and meet the demands of his clienteles in bringing in all that they require.

In the future, Sheway would like to increase the size of his shop and purchase a small vehicle to use for transporting materials for his business from market easily.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for his grocery shop

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is married with one child. She sells men's clothing at one of the open markets in Melitopol, Ukraine.  Elena has been in this business for 10 years.  She was motivated to open a second location due to her growing experience and the constant demand for the goods she sells.  The new location will not only increase her sales and profit, but give another person a job and a stable income. 

Elena requests a 21,000 UAH loan to help her open the second location.  She has used business loans previously and considers them very helpful.

loans.use: to open new business location

loans.name: Juste Justice Justesse

texts.fr:
Client de 25 ans, celibataire sans enfant, a la fin de ses etudes universitaires , n'ayant pas trouve du travail et au chômage, il se lance dans la vente de la friperie.
Il est un client très entreprenant et a deja bénéficie de plusieurs prêts, il fait des épargnes considérables et a une historique de remboursement très efficace et ses différents prêts ont apportes beaucoup de succès  pour  l'évolution de son projet .
Avec ce nouveau prêt , il pense  renforcer et agrandir son commerce en ajoutant encore des draps,des couvertures  des ballots de serviettes et peignoirs , des ballots de veste.
Sa stratégie est de fournir a ses clients des produits de bonne qualité , de fin de série et non utilises a des prix abordables.
Il a pour ambition de devenir un grand homme d'affaire et avec ses bénéfices, il pense a se marier  dans peu de temps.
texts.en:
The client, age 25, is single and without children. After completing his university studies, he was unemployed and couldn't find a job, so he started selling secondhand clothing.

He's very entrepreneurial and already benefited from several loans. He puts considerable amounts of money away, and his repayment history is very good. His loans brought in a lot of success to the evolution of his project.

With this new loan, he intends to bolster and expand his business, by adding sheets, blankets, bales of towels and bathrobes, and bales of jackets.

His strategy consists in offering good quality products to his customers, such as end-of-line items at affordable prices.

He ambitions to become a great businessman and, with his profits, he's thinking about getting married in the near future.

loans.use: to buy bales of sheets, towels, bathrobes, blankets, etc

loans.name: Soem

texts.en:
Mrs. Soem is a resident of Prey Chor district. She is 49 years old and is a single mother of five children. Agriculture is the sole source of her income. She typically generates an average of 3 USD per day. In order to support the family, three of her children work as garment factory workers in Phnom Penh city and send a part of their salaries home monthly to help their mother.
  
With the loan of 600 USD, Mrs. Soem will pay for rented farmland, on which she grows rice and various kinds of vegetables throughout the year. Mrs. Soem hopes that she’ll be able to own a piece of farmland herself.

loans.use: to pay for rented farmland

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is a divorced woman with five children, one of whom still attends school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the high cost of transportation.

For the past ten years, she has operated a food selling business, selling at retail to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing another food stall business in the future.

With the KES 30,000 loan she wants to purchase kitchenware such as cooking pots, plates, and cups. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase kitchenware such as cooking pots, plates, and cups.

loans.name: Asror

texts.ru: Асрор имеет троих детей. Жена домохозяйка. Он заботливый отец и примерный семьянин. Чтобы содержать свою семью он занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур: пшеницы и ячменя также занимается предоставлением услуг по строительству домов и дач. Также он занимается скотоводством. Он имеет хорошие доходы, которые тратит на содержание семьи. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес. Для этого он хочет получить займ в размере  3000 сомони для приобретения мелкого рогатого скота. Он надеется на помощь и поддержку. Спасибо!
texts.en: Asror has three children.  His wife is a homemaker.  He is a caring father and an exemplary family man.  In order to support his family, Asror is involved in growing agricultural crops, such as wheat and barley, and is also involved in proving construction services to build homes and country homes.  He is also involved in animal husbandry.  Asror earns a good income, which he spends on supporting his family.  He wants to expand his business.  For this purpose, he wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 3000 somoni to purchase small livestock.  Asror relies on your help and support.  Thank you!

loans.use: to buy small livestock

loans.name: Oulimata

texts.fr:
Madame Oulimata  âgée de 59 ans  mariée et mère de sept enfants dont  l’ainé a 37 ans et le plus jeune ,22 ans. Elle a duré dans le commerce avec une expérience de plus de 20 ans. Son activité consiste à vendre des fruits. Elle possède une cantine en face de l’Hôpital Régional. En dehors de cette activité elle fait aussi de l’élevage.
Avec le crédit, elle va acheter des fruits. Elle n’a pas de charges  car elle a le soutien de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Oulimata is 59 years old, married, and mother of seven children between the ages of 22 and 37.

She has over 20 years of experience in retail. She sells fruit, and she has a little store next to the regional hospital. Besides selling fruit, she also raises animals.

With the loan, she is going to buy fruit. She doesn't have any expenses because her children help her out.

loans.use: to buy fruit intended for sale

loans.name: Larisa

texts.ru:
Лариса замужем, имеет двоих детей. Двадцать лет назад она начала свой бизнес – выращивание ранних овощей в теплицах. Она выращивает помидоры, огурцы и баклажаны. Лариса любит свое дело и хочет развивать его дальше.

Для того, чтобы успешно начать этот сезон Ларисе нужно закупить семена, пленку для теплиц, дрова для отопления и металлические дуги для текущего ремонта теплиц. Лариса просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 20,000 гривен.
texts.en: Larisa is married and has two children.  She started her business of growing early vegetables in greenhouses twenty years ago.  She grows tomatoes, cucumbers and eggplants.  Larisa loves her business and wants to grow it further.  In order to begin this season successfully, she needs to purchase seeds, plastic for greenhouses, firewood for heating and metal frames for the ongoing greenhouses repair.  Larisa is requesting a loan in the sum of 20,000 hryvnia.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and materials for greenhouses

loans.name: Toshkentboi

texts.ru: Тошкентбой трудолюбивый молодой человек. Он женат имеет двоих детей. Он занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур, также предоставлением услуг парикмахера. Также на отходы от сельхозкультур содержит скот. По бизнесу ему помогает жена. Они вместе работают и прибыль тратят на содержание семьи и воспитания детей. Он хочет получить займ в размере 2500 сомони для покупки корма для скота. Он надеется на вашу поддержку и понимание.
texts.en: Toshkentboi is a hardworking young man.  He is married and has two children.  He is involved in growing agricultural crops and also provides barber services.  In addition, he uses leftovers from the agricultural crops to keep livestock.  Toshkentboi's wife helps him with the business.  They work together and spend the profits to support the family and raise their children.  Toshkentboi wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 2500 somoni to purchase livestock feed.  He relies on your support and understanding.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Elizabeta

texts.en: Elizabeta is 26 years old, married, and has one child, aged two years. She does tailoring to earn a living and has been in the business for five years. Her other source of income is from her husband. Since Elizabeta joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to save her income. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She has applied for 10,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy clothing material.

loans.use: To buy clothing material.

loans.name: Lydie

texts.fr:
Cliente de 41 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 12 et 18 ans. Elle arrête ses etudes en première année d'université quand elle rencontre son mari et met au monde son premier enfant.
 ne pouvant pas seulement s'occuper de son foyer et du ménage, pour être plus active, elle ouvre un restaurant pour subvenir a ses besoins et aider son mari dans les charges de la famille.

Elle a deja beneficiee de plusieurs crédits auprès de Hope, elle a toujours rembourse avec succès et fait constamment des épargnes et avec ses benefices, elle prend en charge la scolarité d'un de son  enfant qui est deja a l'université.
A l'octroi de son prêt, elle compte s'approvisionner en produits de première nécessité comme des bidons d'huile de palme et d'arachide, des vivres frais, tel que cartons de viande, de poulets,du poisson sale et fume, un sac de 50kg haricot. 
Son restaurant est très connu, son succès est du par le fait qu'elle prépare des plats congolais, sénégalaises et européennes, et des 6h , le restaurant est deja ouvert.
Pour l'avenir , elle tient a continuer a amélioré les conditions de travail , ajouter les chaises et tables en plastique , acheter un nouveau congélateur et frigidaire un groupe électrogène pour pallier aux problèmes de coupures d'électricité.
texts.en:
Lydie, age 41, is married and the mother of three children, who are between 12 and 18 years old. She dropped out of university during the first year, when she met her husband and gave birth to her first child.

Unwilling to only take care of her household, and to remain busy, she opened a restaurant to provide for herself and help her husband with the family expenses.

She already benefited from several loans from Kiva's partner, Hope, which she always repaid with success. She's able to constantly put money away and, with her profits, she takes care of the schooling expenses of one of her children, who is already at the university.

Once she gets her new loan, she intends to purchase supplies of food staples, such as cans of palm and peanut oil, fresh food products, such as boxes of meat, chicken, salted and smoked fish, and 50kg of beans.

Her restaurant is very well known. Her success arises from the fact that she prepares congolese, senegalese, and european dishes. Her restaurant is open from six o'clock.

In the future, she wants to continue improving her working conditions, add chairs and plastic tables, buy a new freezer and fridge, and buy a diesel generator to cope with power outages.

loans.use: to buy cans of oil, meat, chicken, fish, and beans

loans.name: Musharam

texts.ru: Мушарам замужем имеет троих детей. Она трудолюбивая женщина и не боится трудностей. Занимается откормом скота. В данном бизнесе помогают все члены семьи. На полученную прибыль от бизнеса она благоустроила дом. В настоящее время хочет получить займ в размере 1000 сомони для приобретения несколько голов мелкого рогатого скота. Она знает, что добрые люди не оставят ее и протянут руку помощи. Она заранее благодарит всех, кто ее поддержит. Спасибо
texts.en: Musharam is married and has three children.  She is a hardworking woman and is not afraid of hardships.  She is involved in fattening up livestock.  All of the family members help with this business.  Musharam used profits from this business to make improvements to her home.  Currently, she wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 1000 somoni to purchase several heads of small livestock.  She knows that kind people would not abandon her and would extend a helping hand.  Musharam is grateful in advance to all, who will support her.  Thank you.

loans.use: to buy small livestock

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en: Dickson is 33 years old, married, and has one child, aged two. He does carpentry to earn a living and has been in the business for five years. He also earns extra income from his farming activities. Since he joined Faulu Kenya he has been able to expand his business. He hopes to expand his business to a big carpentry firm in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy timber

loans.use: To buy timber.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en: Josephine is 41 years old and she sells chips to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years and has employed one person. She describes her business environment as competitive because many people do the same business in her region. Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to save her income. She hopes to see her business grow into a restaurant in the future. She has applied for 10,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy potatoes.

loans.use: To buy potatoes.

loans.name: Bolo

texts.fr:
Madame Bolo  est une femme très active et très brave  âgée de  62 ans. Elle exerce le commerce depuis  22 ans .Elle est marié et mère de cinq enfants dont  l’ainé est âgé de 40 ans et le cadet  de 15 ans. 
Son activité consiste à vendre des fruits : orange, pomme, banane et d’autres fruits de la période.
Avec le prêt elle va acheter des fruits et de l’arachide qu’elle transforme en cacahuètes. Elle est pris en charge par ses enfants ce qui lui permet de réinvestir  son bénéfice dans l’ activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bolo, age 62, is very energetic and brave. She's been a merchant for 22 years. She's married and the mother of five children, age 15 to 40.

Her business consists in selling fruits: oranges, apples, bananas, and other seasonal fruits.

With her loan, she will buy fruits and peanuts. Her children provide for her, which enables her to reinvest her profits in her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and peanuts

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 36 years old, married, and has one child. He sells used shoes to earn a living, which he has been doing for five years. His other source of income is from farming. He describes his business environment as good because there is little competition. 

Stephen is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which he will use to buy shoes. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to expand his business. He hopes to further expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase shoes.

loans.name: Erika

texts.ru: Эрика – незамужняя молодая женщина. Она имеет свой бизнес – продает одежду и обувь в небольшом собственном магазине. Эрика занимается этим делом уже восемь лет.  Ее бизнес характеризуется стабильностью и доходностью. Эрике нравится продажа одежды и она намерена развивать свой бизнес дальше. Эрика просит предоставить ей кредит в размере 10,000 гривен на закупку сезонной одежды.
texts.en: Erika is a single young woman.  She has her own business of selling clothing and shoes at her small store.  Erika has been involved in this business for eight years.  Her business is characterized by stability and profitability.  Erika likes to sell clothing, and she intends to develop her business further.  Erika is requesting a loan in the sum of 10,000 hryvnia to purchase seasonal clothing.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.ru: Шавкат женат имеет двоих детей. Жена домохозяйка занимается домохозяйством. По профессии он учитель. Зарплата учителя маленькая и чтоба содержать свою семью он занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур и откормом скота., так как живет в регионе, где все занимаются сельхозом. Он занимается виноградоводством. Виноградник требует тщательного ухода. Он трудолюбив и усерден. Он хотел бы получить займ в размере 1000 сомони для покупки мелкого рогатого скота. Он надеется на помощь и милосердие с вашей стороны.
texts.en: Shavkat is married and has two children.  His wife is a homemaker and is involved in household work.  Shavkat is a teacher.  However, a teacher's salary is low, and, in order to support his family, he is involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening up livestock because he lives in a region, where everyone is involved in agriculture.  Shavkat is involved in growing grapes, and grapes require thorough care.  He is a hardworking and diligent person.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 1000 somoni to purchase small livestock.  Shavkat relies on the help and mercy from you.

loans.use: to buy small livestock

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ru: Ахмад разводит скот в течении 30 лет, ему необходимо купить корм для своих коз. В настоящий момент холодно и корма для  скота очень мало. В его стадо  более 150 коз, половина дома, а остальные из них находятся в горах у пастуха до весны. Благодаря кредиту его скот будет находиться дома и он будет спокоен.
texts.en: Ahmad has been breeding livestock for 30 years.  He needs to purchase livestock feed for his goats.  Currently, it is cold, and there is very little fodder for livestock.  Ahmad's herd contains over 150 goats, half of which are at home, and the rest are in the mountains with a shepherd until spring.  Thanks to the loan, Ahmad's livestock will be at home, and he will be calm.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed for his goats

loans.name: Gedion

texts.en:
Gedion is 41 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom attend school.  He is a farmer in Nkubu area of Central Kenya and has been in farming for 20 years with the help of one farmhand. His farm produces bananas, milk, and coffee for the local market.

Gedion is requesting his third loan for 30,000 KES, which he will use to buy pipes for installing an irrigation system in his farm and specifically boost his banana farming. His previous two loans for 45,000 KES and 70,000 KES were duly repaid. He plans to expand his coffee plantation, buy more dairy cows, and intensify his irrigation for better farming income. He laments the high cost of herbicides and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase irrigation pipes.

loans.name: Sulaimonkul

texts.ru: Сулаймонкул мужчина 43 лет, отец шестерых детей. Он имеет большой опыт в деятельности животноводства, поэтому много лет занимается откормом и продажей скота. Его жена домохозяйка, которая занимается семейными делами. Сулаймонкул хочет получить кредит на покупку несколько голов баранов и коз. Он искренне благодарен организации за качественное обслуживание, понимание и своевременное финансирование.
texts.en: Sulaimonkul is a 43 year-old man and a father of six children.  He has extensive experience in the animal husbandry business and this is why he has been involved in fattening up and selling livestock for many years.  His wife is a homemaker, who is involved in household work.  Sulaimonkul wants to obtain this loan to purchase several heads of sheep and goats.  He is genuinely grateful to the organization for the quality service, understanding and timely financing.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насиба на протяжении 14 лет занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур. Она замужем имеет двоих детей. Муж помогает по бизнесу. Она выращивает картофель, пшеницу, морковь. Других источников дохода у нее нет. Она хочет получить займ в размере 7000 сомони для приобретения семян, рассады и минеральных удобрений. Она хочет обработать землю и подготовить к весеннему посеву. Она надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарна за поддержку.
texts.en: Nasiba has been farming for fourteen years. She is married with two children. Her husband helps with the business. She grows potatoes, wheat and carrots. She has no other source of income. She wants to get a loan of 7000 TJS to buy seeds, seedlings, and fertilizer. She wants to process and prepare the ground for spring planting. She is hoping for your help and thanks you in advance for the support

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Tonui

texts.en:
Tonui is 26 years old, married, and has one child.  He has been practicing poultry farming for over four years in his hometown of Litein, South Rift, Kenya. He sells eggs to the local market. He also works as a support staff in the local school to earn extra income.

Tonui is requesting a second loan for 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, which he will use to buy additional poultry birds. The additional income will help him boost his family's standard of living. His first loan of 20,000 KES allowed him to acquire a lot of experience.  He laments the high cost of feeds for poultry birds.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Hazratkul

texts.ru: Хазраткул заботливый семьянин любящий отец. У него трое детей из них двое несовершеннолетние. Жена домохозяйка. Также на иждивении у него находятся его родители. Он уважает и любит своих родителей. Для содержания своей семьи он занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур и предоставлением услуг по строительству. Он работает штукатурщиком и каменщиком. Он не боится тяжелого труда. Он хочет получить займ в размере 2000 сомони для покупки крупного рогатого скота и концентрированного корма. Он просит поддержать его и предоставить займ. Он благодарит заранее тех, кто поддержит его. Спасибо
texts.en: Hazratkul is a caring family man and loving father. He has three children, two of them are minors. His wife is a housewife. His parents are also dependent on him. He respects and loves his parents. To support his family he grows crops and works in construction. He has worked as a bricklayer and plasterer. He is not afraid of hard work. He wants to get a loan of 2000 Somoni to purchase cattle and concentrated feed. He is asking for support and a loan. He would like to thank in advance all of those who are supporting him. Thank you

loans.use: to buy cattle and feed for them

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a farmer in Litein, South Rift, Kenya and has been in active farming for six years with his milk and poultry produce sold to the local market. He is age 31 and single.

John has requested a loan of 60,000 KES. This is his second loan after the first one of 20,000 KES. He says he will use the loan to buy an additional dairy cow to boost his farming income and improve his family's living standards. He says he will go for a better breed to ensure his income goes up.

John is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for the loan services.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 27 years old.  He is married to Leah and together they have two children.  He has been operating a barber shop for two years and earns a monthly income of 6,000 KES.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET in the amount of 15,000 KES, which he will use to buy another shaving machine.  With the anticipated profit, he plans to expand his business and educate his children.

His hopes and dreams are to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy a new shaving machine.

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.ru: Муродджон женат и является отцом двоих детей. Он трудолюбивый добросовестный человек. Любящий семьянин. Он является леном дехканского хозяйства и имеет свой земельный участок. Выращивает виноград и зерновые. По бизнесу ему помогают его родители. Он любит своих родителей и старается во всем их поддерживать. Полученную прибыль тратит на благоустройство семьи, воспитание  и содержание детей. Он хочет получить займ в размере 3000 сомони и приобрести несколько голов мелкого рогатого скота. Он уверен, что добрые люди помогут ему и протянут руку помощи. Спасибо.
texts.en: Murodjon is married and the father of two children. He is a hard-working, honest man. His is a loving family man. He works on a communal farm and also  has his own plot of land. He grows grapes and grains. He uses his business to help his parents. He loves his parents and tries to support them completely. The profits he earns he spends on improving the standard of living for his family, on education, and on supporting his children. He wants to get a loan of 3,000 TJS to purchase a few head of cattle. He is confident that good people will help him and lend a helping hand.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 24 years old and conducts his farming activities in Kenya’s South Rift Valley.  His farm produces poultry and milk.  He also operates a tea retail business, sourcing tea from other farmers in the area and selling it to the processors and wholesalers in the local market.

Benard has requested a loan of 70,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow and grow his dairy business.  He previously borrowed a first loan of 30,000 KES, which he promptly repaid.  Benard adds that the loans help him improve his farming business and he expects growth to increase as a result.

He says the major challenge to farmers in the area is the lack of farming skills, which is a necessary requirement for farmers to mitigate the challenges inherent in the business of farming.  He encourages Juhudi Kilimo to intensify its farmer training programs.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Philp

texts.en:
Philip is 46 years old.  He is married to Nyawira and together they have two children.  He has been running a private school for the last four years and earns a monthly income of 12,000 KES.

He is requesting his fifth loan through KADET in the amount of 65,000 KES, which he will use to buy stationery for the school.  With the anticipated profit, he plans to educate his children.

His hopes and dreams are to transform his school into a leading private school.

loans.use: to buy stationery for his private school.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a single lady and she currently has no children.  She describes herself as a good and principled woman.  For the past year, she has run a retail store, selling furniture, such as tables and chairs, and electronics, such as televisions, for use in the home.  Her primary business challenge is the high cost of the items she sells.  She will use the loan of 20,000 KES to buy more electronics.  In the next five years, Mercy hopes to run a larger general store.

loans.use: to buy more electronics, like televisions, to sell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is 29 years old, married and the father of one child.  He sells electronics to earn a living and has been in business for two years.  He describes his business environment as good because his business faces no competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya he has been able to save his income. He has applied for a loan of 25,000 KES in order to buy electric cables, sockets, adapters and chargers.  He hopes to expand his business and open a cyber cafe in the future.

loans.use: to buy electric cables, sockets, adapters and chargers.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a farmer and a businessman running a motorcycle transport business and producing milk for the local market and specifically Kokiche Cooling Plant. He has been in farming for the last five years.

David has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow and give a boost to his dairy business. He says his hope is to generate more income and give his family better living standards. He adds the first loan of 20,000 KES gave him the opportunity to learn and he is now confident he will be able to get better returns.

David says the major challenge is in sourcing for capital since the loans are hard to come by.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias is 51 years old and married with six children. His business is to make pillows to sell. He has been in the business for eight years and has employed three people.He also earns extra income from the sales of used clothes. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business. He hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy wool clothes to use in making the pillows

loans.use: To buy wool clothes to make pillows

loans.name: Jaspher

texts.en: Jasper, 30 years old, is married and has two children ages 7 and 12 years old. He describes himself as an innovative and determined man. He sells milk to frequent and new customers. He has been in this business for the last two years. His business challenge is insufficient funds for buying the animal feed. He will be using the loan of KES 20,000 to buy cow feed used for milking. Jaspher's hope and dream is to be supplying over 100 liters of milk in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy more cow feed

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 38 years old, married to Kirimi and has three children. She has been running a beauty salon for the last two years, earning a monthly income of 28,000 KES.

She is requesting a loan from KADET Ltd of 20,000 KES. She plans to use the funds to buy additional stocks of items such as shampoo and makeup for the salon. With the anticipated profits, she will save and grow her business.

Her hopes and dreams are to improve the salon to an executive level, high-class salon.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of items such as shampoo and makeup.

loans.name: Rudia

texts.en:
Rudiah is married and has three children ranging in age from three to twenty-two years. She describes herself as an optimistic woman.

Rudiah has been selling household goods such as clothes pegs, hair bands, hangers, soap, etc. for the last five years. The high cost of the items she sells is a challenge for her. She will be using a 20,000 KES loan to buy more of the same to sell.

In the next five years, Rudiah's hope and dream is to venture into running a hardware shop.

loans.use: to buy more household goods such as clothes pegs, hangers, soap, salt, hair bands etc. to sell.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is 33 years old and married with two children aged two and four. For the past twelve years he has repaired electronics in order to earn a living. He also employs two people.

Since Silas joined Faulu Kenya, his business has grown. He has applied for a 30,000 KES loan to buy additional spare parts.

Silas hopes to expand his business and open more branches in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 41 years old and married. She has three children aged thirteen, fifteen and eighteen.

For the past five years Ann has sold electronics such as televisions and mobile phones in order to earn a living. She also has two employees. She describes her business environment as busy due to the existence of many other similar businesses.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya Ann has been able to save her income. She has applied for a 100,000 KES loan to buy more televisions and mobile phones to sell.

She hopes to open a big electronics shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy more televisions and mobile phones to sell.

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe is 37 years old, married and has five children. He has been operating a grocery shop for the last two years and earning a monthly income of 6,000 KES.

Wycliffe is requesting a first loan with KADET Ltd of 20,000 KES. He will use the loan to buy stocks of vegetables and fruits to sell. With the anticipated profits he will expand his shop.

Wycliffe dreams of growing his business into a large grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Stephanie

texts.en:
Stephanie is 35 years old and married. She has two children aged twelve and five.

For the past fifteen years Stephanie has sold food such as chips in order to earn a living. She has three employees.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya Stephanie has been able to expand her business. She is applying for a 100,000 KES loan to buy a beef fryer, forks, knifes and a juice machine.

Stephanie hopes to own a big hotel someday.

loans.use: to buy a beef fryer, forks, knifes and a juice machine.

loans.name: Conrad

texts.en:
Conrad, a computer engineer living in the Coastal town of Mombasa, Kenya, is married and has been in business for six years. He was previously employed and saved money to start his computer business.

Conrad is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to purchase computer RAM and hard disks. His main goal is to set up his own working space in the future and acquire more stock. He will save the additional income earned from the loan for other needs/goals.

loans.use: to purchase computer RAM and hard disks.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 32 years old and owns a cereals store. She has been in business for the past four years. She describes her business environment as steady, as her customers are regulars.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to save her income. She has applied for a 60,000 KES loan to buy pishori (basmati) rice and beans to sell.

She hopes to grow into a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: to buy pishori rice and beans to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 24 years old and married with one child aged five years.

Beatrice has owned a computer lab for the past three years. She has employed one person. She also earns extra income from her farming activities.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya Beatrice has been able to save her income. She has applied for a 10,000 KES loan to buy a computer.

Beatrice hopes to expand her business and to employ many people in the future.

loans.use: to buy a computer for her lab.

loans.name: Bibiye

texts.en:
Bibiye is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. She is a single businesswoman who has sold clothes, shoes and handbags for the past year. She started her business with her own savings. Clients delinquent in their payments is a challenge for her.

Bibiye is applying for a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase more handbags and shoes to sell. She will save all additional income coming from the loan.

Bibiye’s ambition is to own a boutique.

loans.use: to purchase more handbags and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Johnstone

texts.en:
Johnstone is forty and married with six children aged between seven and sixteen years. He has been in dairy farming for eight years in his hometown of Litein. His dairy currently produces milk that he sells in the local market.He also sells tea he buys from other farmers in the area.

Johnstone has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase another dairy cow. He says this will be a big boost to his farming business and generate income to meet his family’s basic needs.

Poor weather and weak markets for his milk and tea are a challenge for him.

loans.use: To purchase  dairy cow.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine has sold vegetables to earn a living for the past five years. She also earns money by farming.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya Christine has been able to improve her income. She has applied for a 15,000 KES loan to buy more vegetables to sell.

Christine hopes to expand her business and have a shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase goats for sale

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a single young woman. She describes herself as a social and polite woman. She runs a retail shop and sells items such as sugar, books, bread, tea leaves etc. She has been in this business for the last two years. Her business challenge is the high price of home products. 

She will use the loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy more tea leaves. In the next five years, Rosemary hopes to be selling tea leaves at wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more tea leaves.

loans.name: Cheruiyot

texts.en:
Cheruiyot is 30 and has been in dairy farming for eight years, with his milk production sold to the local market in his home area of Litein, South Rift Kenya. He is married and runs a motorcycle transport and retail shop business besides farming. (He is captured here on one of his motorcycles for transport business although he is requsting a dairy loan.) 

Cheruiyot has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. He says the dairy income will help him improve his family income and living standards. He has high hopes that his business will continue to grow in the future, so that he will be able to make farming his core business. 

He laments the fluctuation in market prices.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is 38 years old, married, and has three children. She has been selling clothes for the last 17 years, earning a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). 

She is requesting her first loan with KADET Ltd of 50,000 KES. She plans to use the funds to purchase more clothes for sale. With the anticipated profits she will educate her children and grow her business. 

Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children to college level and expand her business to be a big clothes store.

loans.use: To buy clothes for sale

loans.name: Mcdonald

texts.en: McDonald is 39 years old and married with four children. He is a businessman and sells goats. He has been in business for 2 years. His other source of income is from is farming activities. Since he joined Faulu Kenya he has been able to educate his children. He hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy six goats.

loans.use: To buy 6 goats.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a single business man who lives within Mombasa, Kenya. He runs a barber shop which has been operating for the last year. Besides this, Joshua also owns a PlayStation.

He was introduced to Milango by a staff member and is currently applying for a loan of 43,000 Kenya shillings to purchase PlayStation machines. Joshua faces no major challenges and has fixed his eyes on acquiring a larger space that can accommodate many PlayStations. 

He will save the additional income for future expenses and to purchase more machines.

loans.use: to purchase PlayStation machines.

loans.name: Ezibatheth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 44 years old and the single mother of two children. She has been selling clothes for the last 10 years, earning a monthly income of approximately Kes 22,000.

She is requesting her first loan with KADET of Kes 30,000 which she will use to buy stocks of trousers, shirts, jackets, bags and blouses. With the anticipated profits she will start another type of business.

Her hopes and dreams are to expand her business and improve her literacy.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a single mother with four children ranging from fourteen to twenty-six years old. She describes herself as an honest woman. She runs a grocery store and sells kale. She has been in this business for the last eleven years. Her business challenge is insufficient funds. She will use the loan of Kes10,000 to buy more kale. In the next five years, Mary hopes to own a farm where she will plant kale.

loans.use: To buy more kale.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married business lady with two children. She lives in Mombasa, Kenya, and runs a printing shop, a venture that has been in operation for three years. She was previously employed in a type setting business where she saved money and started her own business.

She is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to purchase a printer. She looks forward to owning a printing press in the future, despite the challenge of some clients not paying on time.

Virginia will use the additional income from this loan to purchase printing papers.

loans.use: To purchase a printer.

loans.name: Tham's Group

texts.en:
