Gloria está solicitando crédito para poder abastecer de producto lo cual comprara queso, cuajada, entre otros derivados de los lácteos.
texts.en:
Gloria Yane is a 44 year-old enterpreneur who started her business with her own capital.  She learned this business of selling cheese by doing it. Her children, who are still her responsibility, help her in the business. 

Gloria already has a shop in the local market, where she has already established her regular clientele, and attracts casual visitors as well. In addition, she also does home deliveries. 

Gloria is applying for a loan in order to stock up on merchandise, so she will buy cheese, curds, and other dairy products.

loans.use: To buy cheese, curds, and other dairy products.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita en Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Magdalena, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 14, 12 y de año y medio, los  dos mayores estudian en colegio. Su esposo es obrero en una cantera de la localidad.

Ella es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo de Esika (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para dama), tambien vende productos naturales, trabaja tres días a la semana ya sea en la mañana o en la tarde, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y productos naturales. Lleva 13 años  en el Banco Comunal, es la tesorera del grupo y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora ("Our Lady of Help") communal bank meets in Sequita parish in Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí province full of hard-working, dedicated people who are proud of their roots. La Sequita's people are honest and know only how to work and dedicate themselves to their families.

In this place we meet Magdalena, 32 years old. She is married, and from this relationship she has three children who are one and a half, 12, and 14 years old. The two older children are in secondary school. Her husband is a worker in a quarry in the town. 

She is a housewife who, in order to obtain her own resources, sells products from the Esika catalogue (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and ladies' accessories). She also sells natural products. She works three days a week, either in the morning or in the afternoon. She leaves her products on credit and collects every week. She has been doing this work for a year, and it is going very well for her.

This loan is for purchasing perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and natural products. She has been in the communal bank for 13 years and is the treasurer of the group. She likes it because the payments are easy to make. 

Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and natural products.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria Isabel es una emprendedora que se le apoyado con el financiamiento para que invierta en su negocio que es la venta de productos varios, en cual es una emprendedora responsable y un record crediticio muy bueno. Ella nos expresa que el crédito anterior invirtió  todo en su negocio para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes variedad de productos. Actualmente está solicitando crédito para comprar productos como chinelas, ropas , zapatos y otros encargos que ya tiene.
texts.en: Maria Isabel is an entrepreneur who has received support through the loans for her business, which is selling general merchandise. She is a responsible entrepreneur with a very good credit record. She tells us that she used the entire previous loan for her business, in order to be able to offer her clients a variety of products. Currently she is asking for a loan to purchase products such as slippers, clothing, shoes, and other orders she already has.

loans.use: to purchase flip-flops, clothing, shoes, and other orders she already has

loans.name: Martha Asunción

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita en Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 37 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos de 14, 9, 6, 3  y 1 años, la mayor estudia en colegio y vive con los abuelos ya que es de otro compromiso que tuvo, los dos siguientes estudian en la escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella  tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa en el cual  vende empanadas, alas de pollo asadas, corviches, aguas, sodas, jugos, entre otras cosas. En la mañana prepara algunos de sus productos para luego en la tarde venderlos.  También cría pollos y chanchos ya que cuenta con espacio suficiente en su casa para aquello, esto también es una pequeña fuente de ingresos que tiene para salir adelante. Lleva más de 3 años en esta actividad y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito es para comprar 1 mesa, 4 sillas y víveres para preparar los alimentos. Lleva 8 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho en su vida.

Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su vida y su negocio.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora ("Our Lady of Help") communal bank meets in Sequita parish in Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí province full of hard-working, dedicated people who are proud of their roots. La Sequita's people are honest and know only how to work and dedicate themselves to their families.

In this place lives Martha, 37 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage and has five children aged 1, 3, 6, 9, and 14. The oldest, a daughter, is in secondary school and lives with her grandparents, since she is from a previous relationship; the next two children are in primary school. Her husband is a shopkeeper.

She has a small business in her house where she sells empanadas, roasted chicken wings, corviches (a dish made from green bananas and fish), water, soda, and juices, among other things. In the morning she prepares some of her products to sell them later in the afternoon. She also grows chickens and guinea pigs, since she has enough room in her house to do so, and this is another small source of income that she has to get ahead. She has been doing this work for 3 years, and it is going pretty well for her.

This loan is to buy 1 table, 4 chairs, and provisions to make the food. She has been in the communal bank for 8 years, and she likes it because the loans have helped her a lot in her life.

Her dream is to continue moving forward in her life and in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a table, four chairs, and provisions

loans.name: Carmen Maribel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita en Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

La señora Carmen es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que les brinda la institución. Tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo 4 hijos pero dos de ellos fallecieron, los que viven con ella tienen 18 y 13 años de edad  y estudian en  colegio. Su esposo es artesano.

Ella realiza el crédito para el esposo el cual es artesano y tiene un taller en su casa en el cual realiza una gran variedad de figuras hechas en resina y cerámica, él elabora llaveros, escapularios, pendientes, entre otras muchas figuras,  realiza estos trabajos a base de pedidos que le realizan comerciantes que luego los llevan  a otras ciudades donde son muy apreciados. Su esposo lleva más de 17 años con este negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar resina colombiana y estuches para sus obras.
  
Su sueño es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
The communal bank María Auxiliadora meets in the Sequita parish in Montecristi, a prosperous canton in the Manabí province full of hardworking, dedicated people who are proud of their roots. Sequita is a parish where the inhabitants are honest people who only know how to work and take care of their families. 

Carmen is a founding member of the communal bank and likes it because of the benefits that the institution gives them. She is 43 years old, married, and from this relationship had 4 children, although two of them have passed away. The ones living with her are 13 and 18 years old and studying in school. Her husband is an artisan. 

She is getting this loan for her husband, who is an artisan and has a workshop in the house where he makes a wide variety of figures made of resin and ceramics. He makes keychains, scapulars, earrings, and many other figures. He makes these on an order basis for vendors who then take them to other cities, where they are highly appreciated. Her husband has been doing this for more than 17 years and it is going very well. 

This loan is for the purchase of Colombian resin and cases for his work. 

Her dream is to finish their house.

loans.use: to buy Colombian resin and cases.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicharrones [pork cracklings], sweets, biscuits and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a fence

loans.name: Alma Yanett

texts.es: La señora Alma de 33 años es casada tiene 3 hijos y desde hace 2 años ella con el ayuda de su esposo el Sr. Ramiro decidió iniciar un negocio el cual le permitiera apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y que al mismo tiempo le permitiera atender las labores del  hogar como lo son lavar, planchar, cocinar, limpiar la casa y llevar y traer a los niños a la escuela. Buscando Alma la manera de no descuidar ninguna de estas actividades decidió vender hamburguesas y papas fritas en su domicilio acondiciono una área de su cocina para preparar las hamburguesas y poder venderlas sus ventas se han incrementado gracias a la receta y su buen trato con los clientes. La señora Alma requiere el apoyo para compra de equipo como lo es una plancha y una cortadora de papas y poder facilitar el trabajo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Alma is 33 years old, married and has three children and two years ago, with the help of her husband, Ramiro, she decided to start a business which would allow her to help her husband with the household expenses and at the same time permit her to take care of the housework such as washing, ironing, cooking, cleaning the house and taking the children to and from school.

Alma, searching for a way not to neglect any of these activities, decided to sell hamburgers and french fries from her home. She fixed up an area of her kitchen in order to make and sell hamburgers. Sales have increased thanks to the recipe and her good manners with the customers. 

Alma needs help to buy equipment such as a griddle and a potato cutter in order to make it easier to do her work.

loans.use: to buy a griddle and potato cutter

loans.name: Veatriz

texts.es: La señora Veatriz de 69 años es casada y vive únicamente con su esposo en una casa que mientras fueron jóvenes construyeron con ahorros propios y con créditos, desde hace 18 años ella se dedica a la venta de accesorios como los son; aretes, collares, pulceras, pinturas, relojes, cintos para dama y caballero, diademas, broches para el cabello, esmaltes para unas, donas para el cabello y mas productos que ella compra en estados unidos para revender en Mexico desde hace casi diez ellos Veatriz ha sido la única fuente de ingresos para ella y su esposo ellos solventan los gastos de su hogar de este negocio y solicitan el apoyo para compra de mercancía y asi poder ofrecer a sus clientes una gran variedad de productos a sus clientes y al mismo tiempo obtener un ingreso mayor para solventar los gastos de su hogar
texts.en:
Veatriz is 69 years old, married, and lives with her husband alone in a house they constructed with their savings and loans while they were young. For the last 18 years, Veatriz has sold accessories such as earrings, necklaces, bracelets, paintings, watches, ladies and mens' belts, diadems, hair clasps, nail polish, hair decorations, and other products that she bought in the United States to resell in Mexico. 

For some 10 years, Veatriz has been the only source of income for the couple. They cover their household expenses from the business, and solicit assistance in buying merchandise, so they can offer their customers a greater variety of products, and at the same time, obtain a larger income to help cover those household expenses.

loans.use: to buy jewelry, artesan goods and more to sell.

loans.name: Pastora

texts.en: Pastora used her last loan to buy planting materials for cassava production. Pastora's business is successful, so she is now taking pigs as an additional business. She is taking this new loan to buy feed for her pigs. In the future, she hopes to be successful in business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 37 years old and lives in Sto. Niño in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. She is married with three school-aged children. 
To earn a living, Alma has a business selling a variety of fruits and vegetables in the local community. She has been in this business for six years and earns about 5,000 PHP each month. She has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell. 
In 2011, Alma joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She also hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde is from Silanga, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, a widow and has one adult child. 
To make a living, Matilde owns and operates a food vending business in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities. Matilde is requesting a loan of 5,732 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her food vending business. 
In 2009, Matilde joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Matilde's future plans are to have her own car and run a successful business.

loans.use: gain additional capital for her food vending business.

loans.name: Shayamie

texts.en:
Shayamie is from D'ban, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old, married and has four school-aged children. 
To make a living, Shayamie owns and operates a business venture serving a variety of different products to customers in the local community. Shayamie has been in this business for five years and earns 3,000 PHP per month from these activities. 
In 2010, Shayamie joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Johnna

texts.en:
Johnna is married and has three children. She is 29 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 
Johnna used her last loan to purchase additional products and soft drinks to sell. Her business is successful. She's now taking a new loan to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In the future, she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Noli

texts.en:
Noli is a married woman with three children. She is 53 years old and lives in Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. 
Noli owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting flowers for sale to earn a living. She has been running this business for three years. Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP from the business. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 
In 2011, Noli joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she wants to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Marrisa

texts.en:
Marrisa is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Marrisa has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for 15 years. She has requested a loan of 16,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale.
Marrisa has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 
Maricel has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale.
Maricel has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is from Sepac, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 62 years old, widowed and has two adult children. 
To make a living, Teresita sells a variety of food and home use products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for three years and earns 3,000 PHP per month from these activities. 
In 2010, Teresita joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 8,401 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Rosalind

texts.en:
Rosalind is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 4 children. 

Rosalind has a food shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 4 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Rosalind has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rosalind hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa  is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.
 
Elsa  has a food shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Elsa  has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Elsa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 49 years old and married. She is from Labuyo, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Monica raises and breeds pigs to sell. 

Monica has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. Monica joined GDMPC in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase pig feed. In the future, Monica plans to improve the general living conditions of her family and have children.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Jovelyn has a shop that sells vegetables such as squash, string-beans and spices. She has run this business for six years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy vegetables for resale.
Jovelyn has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita is 54 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for her family.
Bernardita runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store. Bernardita has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, shampoo and other groceries. 
Bernardita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Sarlyn

texts.en:
Sarlyn is married and has three children. She is 35 years old and lives in La Esperanza, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 
Sarlyn own and operate a business venture planting and harvesting flowers for sale to earn a living. She has been running this business for three years. Each month, she earns 2,500 PHP from the business. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 
In 2011, Sarlyn joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she wants to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

location.town: La Esperanza, Rizal, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 
Erlinda has a food shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for six years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale.
Erlinda has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Narcisa has a food shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for ten years. She has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale.
Narcisa has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina works hard to support her family. Catalina is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Catalina has requested a loan of PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Catalina has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Catalina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 1 child. 

Susan has a tailoring shop that sews and repairs clothes such as uniforms and jeans. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop.

Susan has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Susan hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop

loans.name: Teodulfa

texts.en:
Teodulfa is married with three children. Teodulfa is 64 years old, residing at Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Teodulfa owns and operates farm land, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. She's been in this business for three years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

In 2009, Teodulfa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Teodulfa wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 45 years old and married with six children. With one child in school, Cecilia works very hard to provide for her family.
Cecilia runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. Cecilia has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.
In the future, Cecilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo and groceries for resale.

loans.name: Khurlee

texts.en:
Mr. Khurlee lives with his wife and his son in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. He has been running a taxi since 2007 around the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has gained experience in his business and already has many permanent customers who he often serves.
Khurlee is requesting a loan to cover the cost of purchasing a car for his taxi business. He needs to renew his car for a better one because his current car is getting old and becoming inadequate for taxi service – possibly giving a negative impression to his passengers. Therefore, he has decided to replace his car in order to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase a car for his taxi business.

loans.name: Honorata

texts.en:
Honorata is a 46-year-old widow who has ten children. She works hard to provide for her family. 
Honorata runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.
Honorata has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for eight years and also earns an income from rice retailing. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle. Helen has been in this business for one year. She earns additional income from raising ducks.
Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is married and has a trisikad (three-wheeled cycle with side cart) transportation business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years. She works hard to support her family. 
Jesusa has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her trisikad.
In the future, Jesusa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her trisikad.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 62 years old with four children. She lives in Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. 

Leonila owns and operates a business venture, selling a variety of shoe products to earn a living. She's been in this business for four years. Each month, she earns 1,200 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. 

In 2010, Leonila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Positively, she simply hopes for  business improvements.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 48 years old and married with seven children.

Leonila works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 15000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Leonila has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for six years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Leonila aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 56 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lorna runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 15000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Lorna has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, coffee, milk, soft drinks, etc. 

In the future, Lorna would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Razel

texts.en: Razel, a 43-year-old  married mother of four children, lives in the Philippines where she has operated a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages for five years. A member of HSPFI since 2009, Razel is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
From Sibutad, Zamboanga del Sur, Gemma is married and blessed with four siblings, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a farmer, while she has been planting and harvesting flowers for sale for the past three years, earning about 2,500 Php per month.

Gemma, who joined GDMPC in 2010 to get funds to help improve her living conditions and to expand her business, is now requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 Php to purchase flowers, fertilizers, and pesticides. She plans to reinvest the additional income arising from the loan back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase flowers, fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en: For the past five years Leonisa, a 50-year-old married mother of seven living in the Philippines, has operated a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. A member of HSPFI since 2007, she has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages. In the future, Leonisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is from Magsaysay, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Rebecca owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of home use products to local community members. She has been in business for three years and earns 5,000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Rebecca joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan for 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support extended members of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla is 53 years old, widowed, and resides with five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling cotton scarves for over five years and is successful in her career. Three of her children are employed: two are garment workers and one runs a motorbike repair shop. 

In order to improve her family livelihood, Phalla is requesting a loan for $500, which will be used to purchase more tools for her son to use in his motorbike repair business. By doing so, he will have enough tools to use for repairing all varieties of motorbikes. In the future, Phalla would like to build a kitchen and support her children to study for their bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase more tools for her child to use in his business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 38 years old, married, and has three children.  She lives in the Philippines. Lydia has a food shop or sari-sari (general) store that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. 

Lydia is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which will be used to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Lydia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 62 years old, married, and has six children.  She lives in the Philippines. Lolita has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. 

Lolita is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which will be use to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, Lolita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en:
Chorn is 57 years old, married, and has four children.  He resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He has been a village leader for over 20 years. 

Chorn and his wife have been involved in growing rice for over 20 years and are successful in their business. He has begun a new business of raising fish to sell in order to generate more income to support the family. 

Chorn is requesting a loan for $1,000, which will be used to purchase fodder to feed the fish so that they gain weight and can then be sold. In the future, he would like to build a new house and support his youngest child to study until he/she earns a bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase fodder to feed fish.

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child.
 
Mary Rose has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Mary Rose has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mary Rose hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children.
 
Liza has a vulcanizing shop that provides repairs of cars and vehicles with her husband as the repairman. She has had this business for six years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and materials needed for the vulcanizing shop.

Liza has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Liza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and materials needed for the vulcanizing shop.

loans.name: Samon

texts.en:
Samon, 42, is married, resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She has been a staffer in the tourism department for over 10 years. Her husband has been involved in agriculture for over 20 years, has extensive experience and is successful in his career. He is involved in growing rice and fishing. 

All of her children are construction workers. In order to improve her family's living conditions, Samon is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to pay for her children's passport fees. By doing so, she will enable her children to legally seek work in Thailand to generate more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to build a warehouse for keeping rice and support her children to study foreign languages.

loans.use: to pay for her children's passport fee to go to find jobs in Thailand.

loans.name: Naumi

texts.en:
Naumi is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
 
Naumi has a shop that sells bananas and coconuts for copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production). 

She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy coconut and bananas to sell.

Naumi has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Naumi hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconut and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Ralph

texts.en:
Ralph is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single and has one child. 

Ralph provides motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for three years. 

He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

Ralph has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Ralph hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has three children.
 
Eric provides motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

Eric has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Eric hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Cristy has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for two years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Cristy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Cristy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Kimly

texts.en:
Kimly, 47, is married and resides with his wife and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

He is a staffer in an agricultural company. His wife is a rice farmer. Two of his children are garment workers. 

In order to improve his family's living conditions, Kimly is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to pay for his children's passport fees. By doing so, he will enable his children to legally seek jobs in Thailand to generate more income to support the family. 

In the future, he would like to build a new house and support his youngest child to study through college.

loans.use: to pay for his children's passport fee to go to find jobs in Thailand.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is from the simple village of Dioyo, Sapangdalaga Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years of age, married and blessed with three adult children. Her husband is working as farmer.

Gemma used her last loan to purchase raw materials needed to make furniture for sale like beds, sala sets and cabinets for tourists and local community members. Her business is successful, and she has discovered that it's better to also engage in a different line of business to double her return. So now she is taking a new loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP to buy grocery goods to sell in her general store, locally known as a sari-sari store. 

She has been this business for around six months. With her general store, she has been able to earn 2,300 PHP a month. This business has been quite a great benefit to the family of Gemma. 
 
In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business and make it bigger.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Menorida

texts.en:
Menorida is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Menorida has a shop that sells fish like tolingan and fruits like mangoes. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy fish and fruits to sell.

Menorida has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Menorida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with three children.  Rita has a shop that sells fish, such as sardines and trout.  She has had this business for six years. 

Since 2011, Rita has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI. She requested a PHP 4,000 loan to buy fish to sell.  In the future, Rita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell at her shop.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy, 48, is widowed and resides with four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  She has been involved in agriculture for over twenty years, has extensive experience and is successful in her career.  Sophy grows rice and raises cattle. Three of her children are employed at the garment factory. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Sophy requests a USD 600 loan to purchase rice to sell at the rice mill. In the future, she would like to expand her rice trading business, rehab her house and support her youngest child to study until he/she gets a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase rice to sell at the rice mill

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta is 45 years old and married with four children.  She is from Villalin, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines.  Benedicta owns and operates a transportation business, providing transportation services to local community members.  She has been in the business for one year and earns 5,000 PHP per month.

In 2011, Benedicta joined Kiva partner GDMPC to access financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She requests a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase tires and other accessories for her transportation business.  Benedicta plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories for her transportation business.

loans.name: Ngoeurn

texts.en:
Ngoeurn, 46, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She sells breakfast foods, such as Khmer noodles and porridge, from home.  Ngoeurn has had this business for over six years and is successful in her career.  Her husband has worked at the river port for over ten years.  All of her children are employed; three are garment workers and the fourth child is a truck driver. 

To improve her family’s circumstances, Ngoeurn requests a USD 1,000 loan for a new business to purchase groceries to sell from her home.   In the future, she would like to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell from home in order to generate extra income for her family.

loans.name: Sam Oeurng

texts.en:
Sam Oeurng, 47, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are carpenters who manufacture tables, chairs, beds and other furniture to sell.  

Due to an increase in clients, Sam requests a USD 500 loan to expand her business.  She will use the loan to purchase wood to produce more furniture to sell to her clients. In the future, she would like to purchase more carpentry tools for manufacturing furniture.  Also, she plans to rehab her house and support her children to study until they get Bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase wood to manufacture furniture to sell

loans.name: Sann

texts.en: Sann, 58, is married, and resides with her husband and three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are rice farmers. Two of her children are employed, one is a blacksmith and another one is a garment worker. Due to the difficulty in farming work, Sann is requesting a loan of 750 USD to purchase oxen to yoke in order to plow her farmland for growing rice. In the future, she would like to renew her house and support her children to study higher.

loans.use: to purchase oxen to yoke in order to plow her farmland

loans.name: Dalila Raquel

texts.es: Dalila Raquel es una emprendedora que inicio su propio negocio con capital propio, este lo emprende por la necesidad de apoyar a su familia en los gastos del hogar y poder salir adelante. El negocio a que se dedica la emprendedora es a la venta de mercadería en general lo cual ella ya tiene establecido los clientes fijos y eventuales a los que les ofrece su producto. Dalila está solicitando financiamiento para comprar mercadería como ropa para dama, caballeros y niños y además cosméticos.
texts.en: Dalila Raquel is an entrepreneur who started her business with her own funds. She helps out her family covering their household expenses. She works as a retailer, selling her products to regular and one-time customers. She is requesting this loan to purchase merchandise, including women, men and children's clothes as well as cosmetics.

loans.use: To purchase women, men and children's clothes as well as cosmetics.

loans.name: Glena

texts.en:
Glena is 37 years old and lives in La, Esperanza Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and blessed with three children. Her husband is a farmer. She helps her husband find earnings for the family.

Glena is in the agricultural business, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. She has been in this business for 3 years and excellently, the return is good. Monthly, she earns in the amount of 2,200 PHP doing this type of business.

Recently, she joined GDMPC and applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase rice farm fertilizer for good growth and nourishment.

She plans in the near future that a portion of the income generated is put back into the business for the expansion.

loans.use: purchase rice farm fertilizer

location.town: La, Esperanza Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Titus

texts.en: Titus is taking another Kiva loan of 60,000 KES to boost his motorcycle business. With the loan, he wants to purchase another motorcycle. Titus dreams of owning a fleet of motorcycles in the future. Thanks to Yehu and Kiva lenders for funding his loan to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle for transport business

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is from Bayabas, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur. She is 30 years old, married, and has three adult children. 

Ailyn plants, harvests and sells "saging" (bananas) for a living. She's been in her business for 2 years and earns 2,000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Ailyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ailyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 45 years old and happily lives in La Esperanza, Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte.  She is married and blessed with four children. Her husband is a pure farmer. She helps her husband generate revenue to sustain the daily needs of the family and for the education of her children.

She is in the agricultural business, planting and harvesting bananas for sale to earn a living. She has been doing this business for 3 years. She earns about 2,050 PHP a month doing this type of work.  

She joined GDMPC to gain financial assistance to help engage in business activities and requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy banana fertilizer for good growth and banana sprouts to plant. 

She hopes that her business will be successful, because she plans to buy a motorcycle to use for banana delivery.

loans.use: to buy banana fertilizer and banana sprouts to plant

location.town: La Esperanza, Rizal, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Julie has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Julie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Julie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Margie has a pigpen and sells grown and mature pigs. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Margie has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Margie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs.

loans.name: G.s. Jerusalen Ii Del El Viejo Group

texts.es: Este grupo Jerusalén II está conformado por dos integrantes en el cual son originarios de la misma localidad ellos se unen para apoyarse uno a otros y salir adelante con sus negocios y además apoyar a sus familias en los gastos del hogar. Ambos se apoyan en todas decisiones que se toman y se motivan unos a otro. Jasmira  es una de la integrante del grupo y su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general lo cual está solicitando crédito para invertir en el negocio para compra de variedad de mercadería.
texts.en:
Jerusalén II is a two-member group, both from the same town, created to support each other in their businesses as well as their families by covering household expenses. They take decisions together and help each other stay motivated. 

Jasmira is a member of this group and works as a retailer. She is requesting this loan to purchase a variety of merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Grecelda

texts.en:
Grecelda is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Grecelda has a shop that sells clothing like t-shirts and blouses. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of clothing to sell.

Grecelda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Grecelda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Rean

texts.en:
Rean is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child. 

Rean has a vulcanizing shop that provides motorcycle and vehicle repairs . She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools and materials for the vulcanizing shop.

Rean has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rean hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and materials for the vulcanizing shop.

loans.name: Ailene

texts.en:
Ailene is from Kapatagan, Lanao del Sur. She is 33 years old. Ailene is married and has two adult-aged children. 

To make a living, Ailene owns and operates a business venture, baking and selling a variety of foods in the local community. Ailene has been in her business for two years and earns 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Ailene is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional cooking ingredients. In 2011, Ailene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a 39-year-old married man. He and his wife Benter and they have children. He has been operating a fish-selling business for the last nine years earning a monthly income of KES 6,000.

He is requesting his second loan with KADET Ltd of KES 35,000 which he will use to buy more stocks of fish to sell. With the anticipated profits he will save to expand his business and venture into farming in his rural home.

His hopes and dreams are to expand his business into other localities and improve the living standard of the family.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en:
Veneranda is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Veneranda has a shop that sells green and yellow bananas . She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy bananas to sell.

Veneranda has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Veneranda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 58 years old and she has four children and several grand-children. She has been practicing dairy farming for the last eleven years.

She is requesting her first loan with KADET Ltd of KES 20,000. She will use the loan to buy cattle feed i.e. dairy meal and molasses. She will use the anticipated profits to buy another dairy cow.

Her hopes and dreams are to venture into large scale dairy farming and help improve the living standard of her children.

loans.use: To purchase cattle feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a blow drier and more seats for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is 24 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with two children. Analyn used her last loan to purchase refreshments to sell. Her business has grown and become successful.  Now, she's taking a new loan to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.  Analyn hopes to be able to continue to grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase new products to sell.

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely, 32-years-old is married with 3 children. She lives in Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte: Philippines. 

Emely operates a service-based business providing motorcycle services to local community members to earn a living. She's been doing this for 4 years and every month she earns PHP 3,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. 

In 2010, Emely joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Emely hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in her business

loans.name: Elvia

texts.en:
Elvia is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Elvia is peddling & selling peanut delicacies like candies . She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy peanuts for sell.
Elvia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Elvia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy peanuts for sale

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with 2 children. 
Amor has a computer shop that provides computer games & online games. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 17,000 to pay for  electricity for the computer services.
Amor has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Amor hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to pay for the electricity for her computer services business

loans.name: Ronie

texts.en:
Ronie is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children. 
Ronie has a shop that sells coconuts & bananas. He has had this business for 3 years. He has requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy coconuts &n bananas for sale.
Ronie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Ronie hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and bananas for sale

loans.name: Joemar

texts.en:
Joemar, is single with one child. He is 26 years old, and lives at Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte: Philippines. To earn a living, Joemar operates a business selling seafood products including crabs, fish and shrimp in the local community. He has been in the business for two years. Each month, he earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of business. 

Joemar requested a loan of PHP 18,000 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. In 2010, Joemar joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. In the future, Joemar wants to save to have a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Remedios has a shop that sells fish such as trout and sardines. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy fish to sell.

Remedios has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Remedios hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is from the village of Sinian Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Elsa is married and has two adult-aged children.

Elsa operates a specialized retail store to earn a living. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over six years and the business runs smoothly. She earns approximately 4,200 PHP a month for these activities.

Elsa's last loan allowed her to purchase additional inventory and have working capital. Her business retail store is successful, now she is taking a new loan for 12,000 PHP to buy supplementary grocery goods to sell.

In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. Teodora has a shop that sells fish such as sardines, milk fish and trout. Her husband fishes, using the fishing boat. She has had this business for two years. 

Teodora requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy fish to sell. Teodora has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Teodora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
Anselma is from Campo 1, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 50 years old, married, and has ten children.  Anselma plants, harvests and sells corn for to make a living. She's been in her business for 25 years and earns 8,000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Anselma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Anselma is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Esterlita has a furniture shop that sells furniture like beds and cabinets. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed for the furniture shop.

Esterlita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Esterlita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her furniture shop.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 26 years old. She is married to Joseph and they have one child. For the last five years, she has operated a clothes boutique, earning a monthly income of KES 24,000.

She is requesting her fifth loan with KADET Ltd of KES 80,000. She will use the loan to buy clothes i.e children's wear, ladies and men’s wear. With the anticipated profits she will save to add more stocks of clothes

Her hopes and dreams are to open a large clothes boutique in Nairobi central business district

loans.use: To buy stocks of clothes.

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Eleonor has a pigpen and sells grown and mature pigs. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy animal feeds for the pigs.

Eleonor has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Eleonor hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
Letty  is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Letty  has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Letty has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Letty hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Rohel

texts.en:
Rohel is married with three children. He is 33 years old, residing at Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines.

To earn a living, Rohel runs a food stall, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. He has been in this business for three years, and each month he earns PHP 5,600 from the business.

He requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. In 2011, Rohel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. In the future, Rohel wants to save to have a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make snacks to sell.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Nestor provides "motorela" or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

Nestor has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Nestor hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

loans.name: Nancy Njeri

texts.en:
Nancy Njeri is a 52-year-old business lady who sells cereals in Kongowea, Mombasa. She is a married mother of four. She has been selling cereals and spices for the last twenty years and she is doing great. This is her third loan from KADET. She plans to use the loan to purchase more maize, beans and garlic to add to her stock. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business and educate her children. 

She hopes to have a bigger shop.

loans.use: to purchase more maize, beans and garlic.

loans.name: Felly

texts.en:
Felly is 35 years old. She is happily married. She has two infant-age children. They live in the simple village of San Roque, Rizal Zamboanga del Sur. She also shares that her family is doing well; despite the hardships the family is able to cope with things.

She is in the retail business, locally known as a sari-sari store. She has been in this business for three years and the revenue generated is quite good. She earns about 2,350 PHP a month doing this type of business.

She joined GDMPC to gain financial access to engage in business activities and wants her business to become bigger. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 PHP to purchase supplementary grocery goods to sell. She is hoping that through her income, she can support the education of her children until college.

loans.use: purchase supplementary grocery goods to sell.

location.town: San Roque, Rizal Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child 

Amelita has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 12 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Amelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Amelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Antonieta has a shop that sells vegetables like radishes, carrots & squash. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy vegetables to sell.

Antonieta has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Antonieta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is from Kinuman, Norte Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Rebecca is married and has four children. 

To make a living, Rebecca raises crops, primarily planting & harvesting corn for sale. Rebecca has been in her business for 11 years and earns 3,500 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2010, Rebecca joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca is requesting a loan of 9,400 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Ma.vangie

texts.en:
Ma.Vangie works hard to support her family. Ma.Vangie is married and has a ready-to-wear sales business in the Philippines.

Ma.Vangie requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like blouses, school uniforms, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing. She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Ma.Vangie would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like blouses, school uniforms, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Gumersida

texts.en:
Gumersida is from Kinuman, Norte Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Gumersida is married with 10 children. She plants and harvests vegetables and corn for sale. 

Gumersida has been in her business for three years and earns 4,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Gumersida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Now she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is married and has two sons, ages five and seven years. He describes himself as an ambitious and optimistic man. His primary activity is photography. He has been in this business for the last five years. His business challenge is insufficient funds for improving the photography business and the high cost of electricity. 

He will use the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy related photo materials. In the next five years, Reuben hopes to run a photo studio.

loans.use: To buy related photo materials.

loans.name: Ma.marivit

texts.en:
Ma. Marivit is 31 years old and married with three children.

Ma. Marivit works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Ma. Marivit has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for six years and also earns an income from E-loading.

Ma. Marivit aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Janalyn

texts.en:
Janalyn is 27 years old. She is single. She lives in the village of Sebac, Sapangdalaga Misamis Occidental. She shares that her parents can't afford to send her to school, so she prefers to have a business rather than not doing anything for a living.

She is in the retail business, running a general store, locally known as a sari-sari store. She has been in this business for five years. She has a net profit of 3,400 Philippine pesos per month doing this type of business.

She joined GDMPC to gain financial support for her business activities. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 8,000 pesos to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to reinvest a portion of the net profit generated back into the business for expansion.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rosita works hard to support her family.

She has a variety-store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income selling fruit. Rosita is borrowing 15,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her variety store.

Rosita has been sustaining her business through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more tons of maize to grind and sell as wheat flour

loans.name: Rosmary

texts.en:
Rosmary is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant in the Philippines. She has been in business for thirteen years. She also earns more from selling fruits and vegetables.

Rosmary has been maintaining her business through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She is now borrowing 45,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients and kitchenware for her restaurant.

Rosmary dreams of saving enough money to continue sending her children to college and expanding her restaurant business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and kitchenware for her restaurant.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 45 years old and married to Vendenle; they have children. He has been raising pigs for the last 21 years, supplying pork to major pork dealers. He also operates a retail shop.

He is requesting a second loan with KADET of 50,000 KES. He plans to use the loan to buy more pigs and add stocks of wheat flour to his retail shop. With the anticipated profits he will educate his children.

His hopes are to expand his pig business and become a commercial pig and pork distributor.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and add stocks of wheat flour to his retail shop.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is fifty years old and a married woman with four children. She lives in Napo, a part of Tudela in Misamis Occidental Province in the Philippines.

Elizabeth sells dressed beef, chicken and pork in the local community to earn a living. She has been in business for three years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP through this type of work.

Elizabeth is been a member of GDMPC for three years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP for additional capital for her dressed meat business. In the future, Elizabeth wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to obtain additional capital for her dressed meat business.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is 45 years old. She is married and has two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Robina has a business selling assorted biscuits in the Philippines. Robina has requested a PHP 49500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more biscuits to sell to customers.

Robina has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Robina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more biscuits to sell to customers.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is married and has five children ranging in ages from 11 to 26. She describes herself as a humble and determined woman. 

Regina runs a retail shop and sells items such as biscuits, sugar, salt, maize flour, sodas, etc. She has been in this business for the last six years. She also sells khat (similar to chewing tobacco) to add to her income. Her business challenge is insufficient funds to improve her retail shop. 

She will be using the loan to buy more items such as sugar, salt, flour, sodas, etc. Regina hopes to run a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt, flour, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Siena

texts.en:
Siena works hard to support her family. Siena is married and has a business of selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines.

Siena has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her stall.

Siena has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Siena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 46 years old. She is married and has three children. With all her children in school, Yolanda works very hard to provide for them.

Yolanda runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Yolanda has been in this business for seven years. She sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soap, detergent and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future, Yolanda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Leilani

texts.en:
Leilani is 36 years old and has a common-law husband and one child. Leilani works very hard to provide for them.

Leilani runs a variety store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Leilani has been in this business for two years. She sells a variety of items such as snacks, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Leilani would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is married and works hard to support her family. She has had a sari-sari store in the Philippines for the past three years.

Lolita has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a married woman, having five children. Elsa is 45 years old, residing at Kinuman, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Elsa owns and operates farm land, planting and harvesting corn for sale to earn a living. She has been 20 years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 12,463 for additional capital to purchase fertilizers. 

Elsa is been a member of GDMPC for almost 3 years. In the future, Elsa wants to make improvements of her house and to finish her children's studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Stanslous

texts.en:
Stanslous is 35 years old, married to Elizabeth, and they have three children. He has been operating a motorcycle transport business for the last three years, earning a monthly income of Kes 6000.

He is requesting his first loan with KADET ltd for Kes 20,000. He plans to purchase another motorcycle for the business. With the anticipated profits he will educate his children and expand his business. His hopes are to grow his business beyond his locality.

loans.use: To buy another motor cycle

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard, aged 34 years, is a married man with 18 children - from which he has five pairs of twins! His dream is to see that these children get a good education. 

A retail shop owner, he has been in business for 12 years, having started as a farmer from which he accumulated savings to start his current business. In future he would like to start up a wholesale shop.

Leonard wants a loan to buy saucepans, plates and sugar for resale.

loans.use: to buy saucepans, plates and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 40 years of age, married to Tom, and they have five children. She has been operating a used clothes retail business for the last three years, earning a monthly income of Kes 6500.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET ltd for Kes 20000. She plans to use the funds to buy more stock of used clothes for sale. With the anticipated profits she will educate her children.

Her hopes are to grow her business and to buy a plot to build a family home.

loans.use: To buy stock of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Maria Riselda

texts.en:
Maria Riselda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling ready-to-wear clothes in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy more items like curtains, blouses and pants.

Maria Riselda has been in this business for three years. Maria Riselda earns more income from her variety store.

Maria Riselda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like curtains, blouses and pants.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is 38 years old and married to Nganga with children. She has been running a retail business for the last three years earning a monthly income of 6,000 KES.

She is requesting her first loan with KADET of 15,000 KES. She will use the loan to buy hardware stock (i.e. paint and cement). She will use the profits to educate her children and expand her business.

Her hopes and dreams are to expand the business into a wholesale hardware shop.

loans.use: To buy hardware stock (i.e. paint and cement).

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nelia is 39 years old and four of her children are in school.

Nelia has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Nelia has been in this business for five years. In the future, Nelia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Naftal Nyandika

texts.en:
Naftal Nyandika  is a 28 year old wholesale shop owner in Voi. He is single. He has been operating the wholesale shop for the past six years and he is doing great. 

This will be Naftal’s first loan from KADET. He plans to purchase more sugar, rice, Blue Band margarine, washing powders and cooking oil to sell to his customers. He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan. 

He hopes to have a more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, rice, margarine, washing powders and cooking oil.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is 32 years old, married and has three children. For the last four years, she has earned a living by selling fish and earns a monthly income of Kes 12,000. She is applying for her second loan from KADET Ltd., for Kes 45,000, to buy more fish to sell to her customers. She will use the additional income earned as a result of this loan to expand her business and pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Stephen Mulwa

texts.en: Stephen Mulwa is a 42-year-old businessman who runs a grocery store in the village of Voi. He is married and has earned a living for the last nine years by operating a grocery store.
