He is applying for his first loan from KADET and will use it to buy more potatoes, tomatoes, cabbage and kale to sell to his customers. He will use the additional income earned as result of this loan to expand his business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Petronilla Mueni

texts.en: Petronilla Mueni is a 25-year-old grocery store owner who lives and works in the village of Voi. She is a single mother with one child.  She has run her store for one year and is doing very well. Petronilla is applying for her first loan from KADET and plans to use it to buy more potatoes, oranges, cabbage, onions, tomatoes and kale to sell to her customers. She will use the additional income she earns to pay for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is 38 years old, married to Anjwang, and they have three children. She has been running a fish-selling business for the last 20 years, earning a monthly income of Kes 6000.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET of Kes 20,000. She plans to use the loan to buy more fish. With anticipated profits she will educate her children and expand her business.

Her hopes and dreams are to open a hotel business.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to stock for sale.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is from Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Yolanda is married and has five school-aged children. 

To make a living, Yolanda owns & operates a business venture, planting and harvesting coconuts for sale. Yolanda has been in her business for seven years and earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2009, Yolanda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Besides a farming business, Mrs. Chan, 50, is a fish seller in a local market of Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She generates an income of around $2.00 per day through this business. Presently she has four children, three of whom are living together with her in their home. 

Now it’s time for her to grow her dry-season rice again. And Mrs. Chan would like to ask for a loan from Kiva to purchase a plowing machine to progress well with her work. These funds will improve her farming business. For her future goal, Mrs. Chan intends to expand her farmland and increase her output for sale.

loans.use: to purchase a plowing machine to progress with her work.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is from Masabud, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years of age, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Marcelina owns and operates a business venture in the agricultural sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Marcelina sells her rice harvest at the public market of her town. Marcelina had been in this business for five years and earns approximately 2,300 PHP per month. 

This is the primary source of income of Ms. Marcelina. She came to the GDMPC office and applied for a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase fertilizer to enhance the growth of her rice. Marcelina revenue will be reinvested back into the business to double the return and a portion of the profit will be used for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to enhance the growth of her rice.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is married and has six children ranging from five to twenty-nine years of age. She describes herself as an ambitious woman. She has been running a general retail stall and sells items such as plates, paper, slippers, etc. She has been in this business for the last three years. Previously she was involved in a farming activity. 

Her business challenge is the high cost of items sold. She will be using the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more paper, plates, etc. In the next five years, Julia hopes to expand her business and run another one near her town area.

loans.use: To buy more paper, plates, etc.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Poblacion Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old, married and has three school-age children. For the last five years, she has earned a living by selling fish in her town's public market. She earns about PHO 3,800 a month, which is her family's main source of income. She recently joined GDMPC and is applying for a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy more fish to sell and to enlarge her shop. She will use the additional income she earns to make her business more profitable, pay for the education of her children and meet daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Chhang

texts.en: Mrs. Chhang is 47 years old and the mother of three children who lives in the Baray district. She has earned a living by growing rice for many years, and supplements her income by working in a local primary school where she sells biscuits, sweets, snacks and drinks to school children. She is a hard-working mother who is committed to improve her family's life. She is applying for a loan to buy 10 piglets to raise and sell. Her goal is to raise her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe is 33 years old. He is married and supports a family of six people. For the past 18 years, he has run a brick-making business, earning a monthly income of KES 26,000.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET Ltd,of KES 30,000, with which he plans to increase output and employ more casual labourers in his project. 

His hope and dream is to educate his children.

loans.use: To increase output and employ casual labourers in his business.

loans.name: Sak

texts.en:
Sak is 56 years old, the mother of 2 children and a resident of the Baray district. She is a local farmer as well as a fish seller in a local market. Her earnings from her sales total $2.72 per day.

Recently Sak bought timbers to expand her present house. However, she has inadequate capital to cover those expenses. She decided to ask for some funds from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to buy additional timbers to complete her home expansion project. Sak hopes that this loan will be granted so she can fix her house.

loans.use: to buy additional timbers to complete her home expansion.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 44 years of age. He is married and blessed with two school-age children. He lives is Carangan, Ozamiz City. His wife is a housewife who cares for the children. 

Samson plants and harvests rice to sell in order to earn a living. The harvested rice is delivered to his contract buyer in the town. He has been in this business for 2 years, and he earns an income of approximately 1,800 PHP a month to support his family.

Samson joined GDMPC currently and has applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer to enhance the growth of his crops. 

Samson hopes that the business he operates will be successful because his goal is to buy another piece of farmland to cultivate.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add more stock to his business.

loans.name: Loeung

texts.en:
Loeung is a 33-year-old married woman who resides in the Baray district with her husband and two single children, who are attending school. She is in the business of selling fish, which are caught by her husband from the Tonle Sap River. She typically earns about $2.40 each day. 

Loeung would like to borrow some funds from Kiva, through HKL, to purchase some replacement fishing materials to support her husband’s business. Her business goal is to increase her sales and gain extra income to satisfy her family.

loans.use: to purchase some fishing materials.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 45 years of age and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is happily married and blessed with one adult child. Her husband is a farmer and furniture-maker.

Josephine owns and operates an agriculture business, planting and harvesting rice to sell. This is the primary source of income for the family. She has been in this business for 10 years, and over the years she has run the business thoroughly. She delivers the harvested rice to her buyer and earns approximately PHP 2,500 per month.

She joined GDMPC just this month to gain financial access to help improve her business. She has applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase pesticides and seedlings for the next season's crops. 

Josephine plans to use the additional profits earned to reinvest in the business and she will also use a portion to meet the family's basic needs.

loans.use: purchase pesticides and seedlings for the next season.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha is married and has three children ranging in age from two years to ten years. She describes herself as an honest and humble woman. She runs a general store where she sells items such as Blue Band (a brand of margarine), water jugs, steel wire, razor blades, and other goods. She has been in this business for the last two years. Her business challenge is insufficient funds to buy additional stocks of the goods she sells.  She will use the requested loan of KES 20,000 to buy more sugar, Blue Band, water jugs, steel wire, and other items. Tabitha's hope and dream is to run a wholesale shop within the next five years.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, margarine, water jugs, steel wire, and other goods.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is from Barangay, Masabud Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years of age and married with five children. Her husband is a farmer.

To make a living, Rosemarie owns and operates a business, raising and harvesting vegetables to sell. She sells her harvested vegetables to the public market in her town. 

Rosemarie has been in this business for 5 years and earns approximately 2,300 PHP per month. This is her primary source of income. 

She came to the GDMPC office and applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer to provide good nourishment to her plants and vegetable seedlings. 

Rosemarie's revenue will be reinvested back into the business to double the return, and a portion of the profit will be used for the family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and vegetable seedlings.

loans.name: Maritess

texts.en:
Maritess is 39 years old and lives in Masabud, Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is married and blessed with three children. Her husband is a farmer.

She established her own small business to help support her husband and to generate income for the family. Maritess works in agriculture, raising pigs to sell commercially. She has been active in this business for 4 years and has generated a good return to date. 

Recently, she joined GDMPC and applied for a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase feeds for the pigs' growth and nourishment. In the near future, she plans to reinvest a portion of the income generated back into the business for expansion.

loans.use: purchase feed for the pigs' growth and nourishment.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a stock of feed and chicks.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима замужняя умная женщина. Она добросовестная и на воспитании имеет четверых детей. Более 5 лет она занимается купле- продажей скота. Имеет хороший опыт и хорошо справляется этим бизнесом. Она начала данный бизнес с купли- продажи мелкого рогатого скота, постепенно расширила бизнес и добавила несколько голов крупного рогатого скота. Муж помогает по бизнесу,  и они вместе продают скот на рынке. Постоянно она советуется с членами семьи, которые поддерживают её и помогают ей. Данный момент Фотима нуждается в средствах для постройки сарая и заготовки корма на зиму.  С этой целью она запрашивает займ в размере 2000$ США. Она надеется на вашу помощь и доброту. Спасибо!
texts.en: Fotima is a smart, married woman.  She is a conscientious person and is raising four children.  She has been involved in buying and selling livestock for over five years.  Fotima has a good experience and manages this business well.  She started this business with buying and selling small livestock, then gradually expanded the business and added several heads of cattle.  Her husband helps her with the business, and they sell livestock together at the market.  Fotima constantly seeks advice from family members, who support and help her.  Currently, she needs money to build a barn and stock up on fodder for the winter.  This is why Fotima is requesting a loan in the sum of $2000.  She relies on your help and kindness.  Thank you!

loans.use: to build a barn and stock up on fodder for the winter

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 34 years old, married, and has one child. She has been in the brick-making business for the last six years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

She is borrowing her first loan of KES 30,000, which she plans to use for expansion of her brick-making project. With the anticipated profit from the business she will build rental houses.

Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children in order for them to have a bright future.

loans.use: to expand her brick-making project.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is a single man and has no children yet. He describes himself as a quiet and honest man. 

He sells electronics and provides repairs for electronics. He has been in this business for the last fifteen years. His business is in a residential area. His business challenge is insufficient funds for improving his electronics retail shop. He will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy more electronics. 

Bernard hopes and dreams to extend his business and venture into hardware activity.

loans.use: to buy more electronics for selling.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Battamabang Province, Moung Russey district is a place in which farming is common. It is the hometown of Keo, who is the mother of four children, three of whom are still in school. She has been working on rice farming for fifteen years as a primary source of income. However, to support her big family, she also works at molding pillars for houses and as a wedding cook for secondary income.

Keo has been with VisionFund for three years. The past loan has provided her family with a better living and managed to get them through the hardships during flooding. She is now requesting another loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and gasoline. She will use a portion to fix her rice milling machine.

She hopes to produce more healthy rice and get more income to support her family, especially her children's education.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Sokhorn's Group

texts.en:
Forty-year-old Sokhorn is the breadwinner of her female-headed family in a village in the Tbaung Khmum district. She is a mother of five dependent children who are still in school. To survive this family, she has been working in a cornfield and growing vegetables for several years. However, she can manage to save only $1 US dollar from her daily income of $4 U.S. dollars.

This is Sokhorn's first group loan with VisionFund and she is a leader of a two-member group. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer and pay for labor for her farmland. She hopes to improve her family's living conditions and to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for laborers

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Silvina quién  invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, ya que vio en este una gran oporunidad de progreso y desarrollo, gracias al cual podrán salir adelante y ayudarse las unas a las otras.

La sra. Silvina esta casada con el Señor Jorge hace 22 años,  tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad, quienes ya son independientes.  Ella comenta que tiene una pequeña despensa, gracias a la cual pudo mantener a sus hijos y darle todo para que no pasen por privaciones. Desea poder seguir creciendo y es por ello que pide la ayuda de fundacion paraguaya y de kiva para la compra de bebidas, lácteos, comestibles y demás artículos de primera necesidad, con lo que podrá abastecerse y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Nos cuenta que su meta es poder tener una tienda para vender helados.
texts.en:
The present committee was organized by Silvina, who invited her friends and made the necessary arrangements to join the Mujeres Emprendedoras program. She saw this program as an opportunity to make progress and support each other.

Silvina has been married to Jorge for 22 years. They have four adult children who are already independent. She has a small store. Thanks to it, she was able to take care of her children and give them everything they needed. She is asking for support because she wants to expand her business. With this loan, she will buy drinks, milk products, food and other essential items to stock up and meet her clients' demands. Her goal is to have an ice cream parlor.

loans.use: To buy drinks, milk products, food, among other things.

loans.name: Milcent

texts.en: Milcent, 34 years old, is married and has two children, aged four and seven years. She describes herself as a determined woman. She provides printing services to frequent and new customers. She has been in this business for two years. Previously, she was employed at a supermarket. Her business challenge is insufficient funds to improve the business. She will be using the requested loan of KES 20,000 to buy more printing materials. Milcent's hope and dream is to run a cyber-cafe.

loans.use: To buy printing materials.

loans.name: Sim's Group

texts.en:
Sim, 58, is the mother of 6 children, one of whom is a dependent working at the family's farm. She is a farmer in a village located in the Tbaung Khmum district. This business has been her primary income source for several years. Sometimes she works for others for pay to better feed her family. She currently earns around US $5 per day and is able to save around US $2.50 daily.

Sim and her group member Theavy have just joined VisionFund this loan cycle. As the leader of this group, she will use this loan to buy fertilizer and pay for labor for her farmland. She hopes to get more income and make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for labor for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Hourng's Group

texts.en:
Houl is a 33-year-old father of 3 dependent children, 2 of whom are still in school while the third helps with the family's business. He is a farmer who has been farming his own plot of land for five years. He also plants rubber trees to generate extra income. He currently earns around US $8 per day to support his family.

Houl and his group member have just joined VisionFund this loan cycle. As the leader of this group, he will use this loan to buy fertilizer for his rubber plantation. He hopes that he will gain more income from this business and make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his rubber plantation.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sam Ang

texts.en:
Originally from a village located in the Sa Ang district of Cambodia, Sam Ang is a 46-year-old widow with only one child. Being a widow, she has struggled to earn a living by selling Khmer noodles, desserts, and rice soup in her village. She has been in this business for more than ten years, and it is her main source of income. 

Sam Ang received a loan from VisionFund four years ago. The loan helped her to make a better living. With her business growth, she is applying for another loan with VisionFund. She plans to use this entire loan to buy more grocery items, such as ingredients, plates, and casserole dishes, for her business. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her business and earn a larger income so she can set aside some money for the future.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for her food business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more chicks, feeds, and medicines.

loans.name: Deang's Group

texts.en:
Deang is 57 years old, widowed, and has five children. Three of her children are dependent on her: two of them work in Thailand and Malaysia, while the last one works at the family’s rice farm. A widow in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Cambodia, Deang has struggled to feed her children as a farmer. This has been her primary business for 35 years. 

Deang received a loan from VisionFund one year ago. The loan has helped her grow rice successfully in order to support her daily living expenses. She completely repaid the last loan with VisionFund. Now she leads a group of two female members in applying for another loan of 250 USD each. She will use this loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her farmland. This loan will enable her to increase her crop yield and gain more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha, 23 years old, is married and has one child. She describes herself as determined and passionate in her work. She sells clothes such as t-shirts, children's wear and curtains along a busy road. She has been in this business for three years. She describes her business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. She will be using the loan of Kes15,000 to buy more clothes to sell. Asha hopes and dreams of running a boutique in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy potatoes, tomatoes, onions, butternuts and green vegetables

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en: Umazi, 49, is a married woman with six children, five of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past four years, Umazi has been selling clothes from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of lack of enough markets to sell her products. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future. With this 30,000 Kenyan shilling loan, Umazi wants to purchase bales of clothes and khangas (traditional garments) to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes and khangas (traditional garments) for sale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 37 years old, married to Mbugua, and they have six children. She has been selling maize for the last three years earning a monthly income of 5,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). She is borrowing 30,000 KES. She intends to use the funds to purchase maize stock for sale. She plans to use the anticipated profit from the business to pay her children's school fees and to expand her business. Her hope and dream is to own a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy maize for sale.

loans.name: Eligio

texts.es:
El Señor Eligio, es de la ciudad de Villarrica, tiene 32 años de edad, es soltero, tiene un hijo. El es propietario de un Taller Mecánico, bastante conocido en la ciudad, heredo el taller y la profesión de su difunto padre, realiza todo tipo de trabajos, reparaciones y mantenimientos en general de Motocicletas, también prepara motores para competición por lo cual mantiene una clientela formada.
Acude a  Fundación Paraguaya y a kiva para  acceder a una pequeña ayuda que quiere destinar a  la compra de Lubricantes, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda en su negocio. Agradece la oportunidad que estas le dan de poder progresar y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Eligio is from the city Villarrica. He is 32 years old, single, and has one son. He is the owner of a mechanic shop, well known in the city. He inherited the shop and the profession from his late father. He does all types of jobs, repairs and general maintenance of motorcycles and he is also prepares motors for competition, for which he maintains consistent customers.

He comes to Fundación Paraguaya and kiva in order to access some assistance that he wants to allocate to the purchase of lubricant, which will be of great help to his business. He appreciates the opportunity that he has been given to be able to progress and help his family.

loans.use: to buy lubricants to sell in the shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy grocery items for her store.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema, 40 years old, is married and has eight children ranging in age from 7 to 23 years old. She describes herself as an honest, determined and jovial woman. She has been selling water to residents in her area for the last five years. Rehema also runs a restaurant to increase her income. Her business challenge is delay in payments from her customers. She will use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy restaurant chairs and tables. In the next five years, Rehema plans to run a hotel in her town.

loans.use: to purchase chairs and tables for a restaurant.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 42-years-old married and they have two children. She has been operating a grocery store for the last 14 years earning a monthly income of kes 15,000.

She is borrowing her first loan of kes 30,000 which she intends to use to purchase more stock of kale, potatoes, cabbage and fruit for her business. She plans to expand her business with the anticipated profit.

Her hopes and dreams are to become a grocery wholesaler.

loans.use: to expand her business.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
La señora Brigida es de la ciudad de Pilar, es comerciante, y además empleada del estado. Tiene conjuntamente con su marido un puesto de ventas de comidas y bebidas. En el cual trabajan juntos.
Tiene ventas de comidas rápidas como ser lomitos, hamburguesas, panchos y choripan desde hace 15 años. El puesto de comidas está ubicado en una zona estratégica de la ciudad, lo que les ayuda a tener una buena clientela.
Solicita el crédito para compras de insumos para su negocio, como ser carnes, huevos, condimentos, aderezos y demás. Agradece también por la oportunidad de crédito y los  buenos servicios que le brinda la institución para el crecimiento de su microempresa.
texts.en:
Brigida is from the city of Pilar, is a merchant and is also a state employee. Together with her husband, she has a point of sales of foods and drinks in which they work together.
She has had the sales of fast foods like sandwiches, hamburgers, hot dogs and sausages for 15 years. The food stall is located in a strategic zone of the city, which helps them to have good clientele.
She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her business, like meat, eggs, condiments, seasonings and more. She appreciates the opportunity for the loan and the good services that the institution provides her for the growth of  her small business.

loans.use: to buy meat, eggs, condiments, seasonings and more.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 48-years-old, married and has 4 children. She buys and sells milk in the Kamobo trading centre and has been in operation for the last 4 years earning a monthly income of kes 15,000.

Mary is requesting her fifth loan of kes 60,000 after she successfully paid the previous loans.  She wishes to use the funds to pay milk suppliers and also improve her business. With the anticipated profits she will educate her children and improve her business.

Her dream is to prosper in business and live a happy life.

loans.use: to pay the milk suppliers

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is 50-years-old. He describes himself as a funny, responsible and faithful man. He sells clothes and materials. He has been in this business for the last four years. Previously, he was involved in cooking and selling fish. His business challenge is the high cost of clothes when buying them. He will be using the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more clothes for selling. In the future, Patrick hopes and plans to run a boutique in Mombasa town.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Togetherness Group

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Ennice from Machipisa, Harare. She is married with two children; one attending school. She also cares for one dependent. Ennice runs a retail business selling clothes bought from South Africa and Botswana. The business has been in operation for 5 years. She says the main challenges she faces are the shortage of capital and competition. 

Ennice has requested a loan of $400.00 to buy additional stock for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to send her child to a better school and pay school fees on time. In the future Ennice plans to own a clothing shop.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for resale.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lillian is 26-years-old, married and blessed with 3 children. Lillian sews table clothes in Nyakach West trading centre and has been in this business for the last 4 years earning a monthly income of kes 2,000.

She is applying for her second loan with KADET ltd of kes 30,000. She plans to use the funds to purchase stock textile material for her business. With the anticipated profits she will educate her school going children.

Her dream is to improve her business and look after the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for the business.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
El grupo que lleva por nombre San Francisco, es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, está integrado por 20 mujeres, quienes son todas amigas y vecinas de barrio. Ellas se unieron con el objetivo de trabajar juntas, y por medio de este trabajo poder ayudarse las unas a las otras y salir adelante. Ellas trabajan en forma conjunta y siempre tratando de ayudarse.
La señora Elena es una de las miembros, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, emprendedora y luchadora, y comenta que gracias a su trabajo y sacrificio ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia y cubrir los gastos que diariamente surgen. Ella se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de prendas, como ser remeras, jeans, bermudas, camisas y demás, ya que siempre tiene buenas prendas, ya pudo formarse una buena clientela y hoy en día es una microempresaria exitosa.
Ella pide la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva para poder tener más variedad de prendas, y de esa forma atraer a más clientes y tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
The group, which is called San Francisco is from the city of Coronel Oviedo, is made up of 20 women, who are all friends and neighbors in the neighborhood. They came together with the objective of working together, and through this work, be able to help themselves and each other succeed. They work in a collaborative way and are always trying to help each other progress.

Elena is one of these members. She is a hard working women, entrepreneur and fighter, and she says that thanks to her work and sacrifice she has been able to succeed and help her family to cover the expenses that arise daily. She sells all types of clothes for a living, like t-shirts, jeans, shorts, shirts and more. She always has good clothes and she was already able to develop good clientele and is today a successful small business.
She asks for the assistance of the foundation and of kiva to be able to have a greater variety of cloths and in this way attract more clients and make more income.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a single young man. He has no children yet. He describes himself as an honest and principled man. He has been running a barber shop for the last two years. In addition, David also sells khat to increase his income. He has one employee. His business challenge is lack of enough funds for improving the barber shop. He will use the loan KES 20,000 to buy a shaving machine. His dream is to expand his business and employ people.

loans.use: To buy a shaving machine.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 56 years old, married to Rodha and blessed with 10 children. He has been selling maize for the last five years, earning a monthly income of KES 3,000.

He is requesting his first loan of KES 30,000. He intends to purchase more maize to sell. He will use the anticipated profit from the business to pay school fees for his children.

His hope and dream is to buy a plot for his children.

loans.use: To purchase maize to sell

loans.name: Charity Wangechi

texts.en:
Charity Wangechi is a 42-year-old clothes seller from Mikindani, Mombasa. She has been selling clothes for the past four years and her business is doing well. 

This is Charity’s second business loan from KADET. She plans to purchase more shirts, trousers, skirts and dresses to sell to her customers. Charity will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and buy furnishings for her house. She also hopes to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase more shirts, trousers, skirts and dresses to sell.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a 24-year-old married man with one child, too young for school. He lives in a rental house with neither electricity or piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

For the past three years, Juma has operated a retail shop, selling items at the market to his neighbours and passersby. The major challenge in his place of operation is seasonality. With a loan of KES 20,000 Juma wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and rice to sell. 

Juma decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business. He has a dream for the future to expand his business to wholesale and to hire more employees.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and rice.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is married and has two children. He describes himself as an honest and ambitious man. He runs a butcher shop and sells meat. He has been in this business for the last four years. His business challenge is the high cost of meat when buying it. He will be using the loan of  KES 20,000 to buy more meat. In the next five years, Paul plans and dreams to venture into a new business in the vehicle industry.

loans.use: To buy more meat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sugar, maize flour, rice and cooking oil

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en: Leonard is 45 years old and married with six children. He sells (omena) small dried fish to earn a living and he has been in the business for four years. His other source of income is from his employment. He describes his business environment as good because there is no competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to open a tailoring business for his wife. He hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy (omena) small dried fish for resale.

loans.use: To buy (omena) small dried fish for resale

loans.name: Luke

texts.en: Luke is 35 years old and married with five children. He sells fish to earn a living. He has been in the business for four years and has employed one person. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow financially. He hopes to open a wholesale store in the future. He has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a fridge to store fish.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator to store fish
